Kindness is invincible, but only when it’s sincere, with no hypocrisy or faking. For what can even the most malicious person do if you keep showing kindness and, if given the chance, you gently point out where they went wrong—right as they are trying to harm you?

What’s the point of having countless books and libraries, whose titles could hardly be read through in a lifetime. The learner is not taught, but burdened by the sheer volume, and it’s better to plant the seeds of a few authors than to be scattered about by many.
You get what you deserve. Instead of being a good person today, you choose instead to become one tomorrow.

I don’t complain about the lack of time ... what little I have will go far enough. Today—this day—will achieve what no tomorrow will fail to speak about. I will lay siege to the gods and shake up the world.

Joy for human beings lies in proper human work. And proper human work consists in: acts of kindness to other human beings, disdain for the stirrings of the senses, identifying trustworthy impressions, and contemplating the natural order and all that happens in keeping with it.

I’m constantly amazed by how easily we love ourselves above all others, yet we put more stock in the opinions of others than in our own estimation of self... How much credence we give to the opinions our peers have of us and how little to our very own!
Well-being is realized by small steps, but is truly no small thing.
Work nourishes noble minds.
What is your vocation? To be a good person.
We like to say that we don’t get to choose our parents, that they were given by chance—yet we can truly choose whose children we’d like to be.
If you find something very difficult to achieve yourself, don’t imagine it impossible—for anything possible and proper for another person can be achieved as easily by you.
How much more harmful are the consequences of anger and grief than the circumstances that aroused them in us!
To the youngster talking nonsense Zeno said, ‘The reason why we have two ears and only one mouth is so we might listen more and talk less.’
Don’t be ashamed of needing help. You have a duty to fulfill just like a soldier on the wall of battle. So what if you are injured and can’t climb up without another soldier’s help?

Let Fate find us prepared and active. Here is the great soul—the one who surrenders to Fate. The opposite is the weak and degenerate one, who struggles with and has a poor regard for the order of the world, and seeks to correct the faults of the gods rather than their own.

Don’t let your reflection on the whole sweep of life crush you. Don’t fill your mind with all the bad things that might still happen. Stay focused on the present situation and ask yourself why it’s so unbearable and can’t be survived.

If then it’s not that the things you pursue or avoid are coming at you, but rather that you in a sense are seeking them out, at least try to keep your judgment of them steady, and they too will remain calm and you won’t be seen chasing after or fleeing from them.
We should take wandering outdoor walks, so that the mind might be nourished and refreshed by the open air and deep breathing.
This is why we say that nothing happens to the wise person contrary to their expectations.

How does it help, my husband, to make misfortune heavier by complaining about it? This is more fit for a king—to seize your adversities head on. The more precarious his situation, the more imminent his fall from power, the more firmly he should be resolved to stand and fight. It isn’t manly to retreat from fortune.
This is what you should teach me, how to be like Odysseus—how to love my country, wife and father, and how, even after suffering shipwreck, I might keep sailing on course to those honorable ends.
When you’ve done well and another has benefited by it, why like a fool do you look for a third thing on top—credit for the good deed or a favor in return?

As Plato said, every soul is deprived of truth against its will. The same holds true for justice, self-control, goodwill to others, and every similar virtue. It’s essential to constantly keep this in your mind, for it will make you more gentle to all.
Nothing is noble if it’s done unwillingly or under compulsion. Every noble deed is voluntary.
Receive without pride, let go without attachment.

When you see someone often flashing their rank or position, or someone whose name is often bandied about in public, don’t be envious; such things are bought at the expense of life... Some die on the first rungs of the ladder of success, others before they can reach the top, and the few that make it to the top of their ambition through a thousand indignities realize at the end it’s only for an inscription on their gravestone.
Often injustice lies in what you aren’t doing, not only in what you are doing.

Trust me, real joy is a serious thing. Do you think someone can, in the charming expression, blithely dismiss death with an easy disposition? Or swing open the door to poverty, keep pleasures in check, or meditate on the endurance of suffering? The one who is comfortable with turning these thoughts over is truly full of joy, but hardly cheerful. It’s exactly such a joy that I would wish for you to possess, for it will never run dry once you’ve laid claim to its source.

At this moment you aren’t on a journey, but wandering about, being driven from place to place, even though what you seek—to live well—is found in all places. Is there any place more full of confusion than the Forum? Yet even there you can live at peace, if needed.
Silence is a lesson learned from the many sufferings of life.
Apply yourself to thinking through difficulties—hard times can be softened, tight squeezes widened, and heavy loads made lighter for those who can apply the right pressure.
Wherever a person can live, there one can also live well; life is also in the demands of court, there too one can live well.
We don’t abandon our pursuits because we despair of ever perfecting them.
I’ll never be ashamed to quote a bad writer with a good saying.

I was shipwrecked before I even boarded ... the journey showed me this—how much of what we have is unnecessary, and how easily we can decide to rid ourselves of these things whenever it’s necessary, never suffering the loss.
No person has the power to have everything they want, but it is in their power not to want what they don’t have, and to cheerfully put to good use what they do have.
Men, the philosopher’s lecture-hall is a hospital—you shouldn’t walk out of it feeling pleasure, but pain, for you aren’t well when you enter it.
You can bind up my leg, but not even Zeus has the power to break my freedom of choice.

No one is crushed by Fortune, unless they are first deceived by her ... those who aren’t pompous in good times, don’t have their bubbles burst with change. Against either circumstance, the stable person keeps their rational soul invincible, for it’s precisely in the good times they prove their strength against adversity.
But there is no reason to live and no limit to our miseries if we let our fears predominate.
Success comes to the lowly and to the poorly talented, but the special characteristic of a great person is to triumph over the disasters and panics of human life.
Leisure without study is death—a tomb for the living person.

Nothing can satisfy greed, but even a small measure satisfies nature. So it is that the poverty of an exile brings no misfortune, for no place of exile is so barren as not to produce ample support for a person.
Better to trip with the feet than with the tongue.
The best way to avenge yourself is to not be like that.

How much better to heal than seek revenge from injury. Vengeance wastes a lot of time and exposes you to many more injuries than the first that sparked it. Anger always outlasts hurt. Best to take the opposite course. Would anyone think it normal to return a kick to a mule or a bite to a dog?

Everything turns on your assumptions about it, and that’s on you. You can pluck out the hasty judgment at will, and like steering a ship around the point, you will find calm seas, fair weather and a safe port.
Dig deep within yourself, for there is a fountain of goodness ever ready to flow if you will keep digging.
Crimes often return to their teacher.
The human being is born with an inclination toward virtue.
Don’t seek for everything to happen as you wish it would, but rather wish that everything happens as it actually will—then your life will flow well.

It is easy to praise providence for anything that may happen if you have two qualities: a complete view of what has actually happened in each instance and a sense of gratitude. Without gratitude what is the point of seeing, and without seeing what is the object of gratitude?

Don’t trust in your reputation, money, or position, but in the strength that is yours—namely, your judgments about the things that you control and don’t control. For this alone is what makes us free and unfettered, that picks us up by the neck from the depths and lifts us eye to eye with the rich and powerful.
When you are distressed by an external thing, it’s not the thing itself that troubles you, but only your judgment of it. And you can wipe this out at a moment’s notice.
If we judge as good and evil only the things in the power of our own choice, then there is no room left for blaming gods or being hostile to others.
Hecato says, ‘cease to hope and you will cease to fear.’ ... The primary cause of both these ills is that instead of adapting ourselves to present circumstances we send out thoughts too far ahead.
In short, you must remember this—that if you hold anything dear outside of your own reasoned choice, you will have destroyed your capacity for choice.
How satisfying it is to dismiss and block out any upsetting or foreign impression, and immediately to have peace in all things.

Let us prepare our minds as if we’d come to the very end of life. Let us postpone nothing. Let us balance life’s books each day... The one who puts the finishing touches on their life each day is never short of time.
Let each thing you would do, say or intend be like that of a dying person.

Think of the life you have lived until now as over and, as a dead man, see what’s left as a bonus and live it according to Nature. Love the hand that fate deals you and play it as your own, for what could be more fitting?
It’s better to conquer grief than to deceive it.
I say, let no one rob me of a single day who isn’t going to make a full return on the loss.
This is the mark of perfection of character—to spend each day as if it were your last, without frenzy, laziness, or any pretending.

Think of the whole universe of matter and how small your share. Think about the expanse of time and how brief—almost momentary—the part marked for you. Think of the workings of fate and how infinitesimal your role.
Many times an old man has no other evidence besides his age to prove he has lived a long time.
You are afraid of dying. But, come now, how is this life of yours anything but death?
You know what wine and liqueur tastes like. It makes no difference whether a hundred or a thousand bottles pass through your bladder—you are nothing more than a filter.

It’s not at all that we have too short a time to live, but that we squander a great deal of it. Life is long enough, and it’s given in sufficient measure to do many great things if we spend it well. But when it’s poured down the drain of luxury and neglect, when it’s employed to no good end, we’re finally driven to see that it has passed by before we even recognized it passing. And so it is—we don’t receive a short life, we make it so.
Everything lasts for a day, the one who remembers and the remembered.

In all things we should try to make ourselves be as grateful as possible. For gratitude is a good thing for ourselves, in a manner in which justice, commonly held to belong to others, is not. Gratitude pays itself back in large measure.
To bear trials with a calm mind robs misfortune of its strength and burden.

Stop wandering about! You aren’t likely to read your own notebooks, or ancient histories, or the anthologies you’ve collected to enjoy in your old age. Get busy with life’s purpose, toss aside empty hopes, get active in your own rescue—if you care for yourself at all—and do it while you can.
Live, travel, adventure, bless, and don’t be sorry.
Trust the dreams, for in them is hidden the gate to eternity.
Life is a helluva lot more fun if you say “yes” rather than “no”.
The purpose of life...# is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.
If you think adventure is dangerous, try routine; it is lethal.
Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air’s salubrity.
When you put your hand in a flowing stream, you touch the last that has gone before and the first of what is still to come.
It is advisable to look from the tide pool to the stars and then back to the tide pool again.
Turn your face to the sun and the shadows fall behind you.
For my part, i travel not to go anywhere but to go. i travel for travel’s sake.
If you can find a path with no obstacles, it probably doesn’t lead anywhere.
Not till we are lost… do we begin to find ourselves.
The bold adventurer succeeds the best.
Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.
Forget not that the earth delights to feel your bare feet and the winds long to play with your hair.
Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one’s courage.
A lake carries you into recesses of feeling otherwise impenetrable.
A rolling stone gathers no moss.
There is no instinct like that of the heart.
Good company makes the way seem short.
There is always something to make you wonder in the shape of a tree, the trembling of a leaf.
Every moment is a fresh beginning.
If happiness is the goal... then adventures should be top priority.
Start where you are. use what you have. do what you can.
Smooth seas do not make skillful sailors.
The sight of the stars always makes me dream.
A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
A true traveller has no fixed plan, and is not intent on arriving.
The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
Plunge boldly into the thick of life... seize it where you will, it is always interesting.
Adventure is not outside man; it is within.

"Whenever I see an erring man, I say to myself I have also erred; when I see a lustful man I say to myself, so was I once; and in this way I feel kinship with everyone in the world and feel that I cannot be happy without the humblest of us being happy."
Morality is the basis of things and truth is the substance of all morality.
"Victory attained by violence is tantamount to a defeat, for it is momentary."
I believe that a man is the strongest soldier for daring to die unarmed.
We win justice quickest by rendering justice to the other party.

"Rationalists are admirable beings, rationalism is a hideous monster when it claims for itself omnipotence. Attribution of omnipotence to reason is as bad a piece of idolatry as is worship of stock and stone believing it to be God. I plead not for the suppression of reason, but for a due recognition of that in us which sanctifies reason."
Mental violence has no potency and injures only the person whose thoughts are violent. It is otherwise with mental non-violence. It has potency which the world does not yet know.
Freedom is not worth having if it does not include the freedom to make mistakes.
"Non-violence requires a double faith, faith in God and also faith in man."

"Consciously or unconsciously, every one of us does render some service or other. If we cultivate the habit of doing this service deliberately, our desire for service will steadily grow stronger, and will make, not only our own happiness, but that of the world at large."
"If anybody said that I should die if I did not take beef-tea or mutton, even under medical advice, I would prefer death"
"Greatness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony."

"When I despair, remember that all through history the way of truth and love has always won. There have been tyrants and murderers and for a time they seem invincible but in the end, they always fall and think of it, always."

"Civilization is the encouragement of differences. Civilization thus becomes a synonym of democracy. Force, violence, pressure, or compulsion with a view to conformity, is both uncivilized and undemocratic."
Exercise of faith will be the safest where there is a clear determination summarily to reject all that is contrary to truth and love
"Non-violence, which is the quality of the heart, cannot come by an appeal to the brain."
"I shall be alive in my grave, and what is more, speaking from it."
The control of the palate is a valuable aid for the control of the mind.
Those who say religion has nothing to do with politics do not know what religion is.
All my actions have their rise in my inalienable love of mankind.
"I know, to banish anger altogether from one's breast is a difficult task. It cannot be achieved through pure personal effort. It can be done only by God's grace."
Men say I am a saint losing myself in politics. The fact is that I am a politician trying my hardest to be a saint.
"All of your scholarship, all your study of Shakespeare and Wordsworth would be vain if at the same time you did not build your character and attain mastery over your thoughts and your actions"
Non-violence is not merely a personal virtue. It is also a social virtue to be cultivated like other virtues.
Be the change you want to see in the world.
Non-violence and truth are inseparable and presuppose one another.

"Strictly speaking, no activity and no industry is possible without a certain amount of violence, no matter how little. Even the very process of living is impossible without a certain amount of violence. What we have to do is to minimize it to the greatest extent possible."
To laugh at men of sense is the privilege of fools.
There is more to life than simply increasing its speed.
"I hold today the same opinion as I held then. To my mind, the life of a lamb is no less precious than that of a human being"
You can't shake hands with a clenched fist.
The law an eye for an eye makes the whole world blind.
"There is a great deal of truth in the saying that man becomes what he eats. The grosser the food, the grosser the body."

"I have learnt through the bitter experience the one supreme lesson to conserve my anger, and as heat conserved is transmuted into energy, even so our anger controlled can be transmuted in to a power which can move the world."

"Hatred ever kills, love never dies such is the vast difference between the two. What is obtained by love is retained for all time. What is obtained by hatred proves a burden in reality for it increases hatred."
Indeed one's faith in one's plans and methods is truly tested when the horizon before one is the blackest.
"Constant development is the law of life, and a man who always tries to maintain his dogmas in order to appear consistent drives himself into a false position."
"To a true artist only that face is beautiful which, quite apart from its exterior, shines with the truth within the soul"
"Prayer is not an old woman's idle amusement. Properly understood and applied, it is the most potent instrument of action."
"Often in my progress I have had faint glimpses of the absolute Truth, God; and daily, the conviction is growing upon me that He alone is real and all else is unreal."
"The real ornament of woman is her character, her purity."
"I know, to banish anger altogether from one`s breast is a difficult task.  It cannot be achieved through pure personal effort.  It can be done only by God`s grace."

The sacrifice which causes sorrow to the doer of the sacrifice is no sacrifice. Real sacrifice lightens the mind of the doer and gives him a sense of peace and joy. The Buddha gave up the pleasures of life because they had become painful to him.
"As long as you derive inner help and comfort from anything, keep it."
In the flames of love even the hardest iron will melt.
Prayer is the most potent instrument of action.
There is no god higher than truth.
"A 'NO' uttered from deepest conviction is better and greater than a 'YES' merely uttered to please, or what is worse, to avoid trouble."
"God, as Truth, has been for me a treasure beyond price. May He be so to every one of us."
"You can chain me, you can torture me, you can even destroy this body, but you will never imprison my mind."
"The more efficient a force is, the more silent and the more subtle it is."
"God is, even though the whole world deny him. Truth stands, even if there be no public support. It is self-sustained."
"All will be well with us if even in the hour of our travail, we are able to realize the presence of God within us."
"A man who was completely innocent, offered himself as a sacrifice for the good of others, including his enemies, and became the ransom of the world. It was a perfect act."
No power on earth can subjugate you when you are armed with the sword of ahimsa. It ennobles both the victor and the vanquished.
For me every ruler is alien that defies public opinion.
"All faiths constitute a revelation of Truth, but all are imperfect and liable to error"
"If your heart acquires strength, you will be able to remove blemishes from others without thinking evil of them."
"Woman is the companion of man, gifted with equal mental capacity."
I know of no greater sin than to oppress the innocent in the name of God.
"I'm a lover of my own liberty, and so I would do nothing to restrict yours. I simply want to please my own conscience, which is God."
"The greater our innocence, the greater our strength and the swifter our victory."
Peace is the most powerful weapon of mankind. It takes more courage to take a blow than to give one. It takes more courage to try and talk things through than to start a war.
"The history of the world is full of men who rose to leadership, by sheer force of self-confidence, bravery and tenacity."
Always aim at complete harmony of thought and word and deed. Always aim at purifying your thoughts and everything will be well
God has no religion.
"I worship God as truth only. I have not yet found him, but I am seeking after him."

"It's the action, not the fruit of the action, that's important. You have to do the right thing. It may not be in your power, may not be in your time, that there'll be any fruit. But that doesn't mean you stop doing the right thing. You may never know what results come from your action. But if you do nothing, there will be no result."
To a man with an empty stomach food is God.
Faith is the function of the heart.
Healthy discontent is the prelude to progress.
"It is any day better to stand erect with a broken and bandaged head then to crawl on one's belly, in order to be able to save one's head."
"I look only to the good qualities of men. Not being faultless myself, I won't presume to probe into the faults of others."
There is no principle worth the name if it is not wholly good.
My imperfections and failures are as much a blessing from God as my successes and my talents and I lay them both at his feet.
Evil has no separate existence at all; it is only good or truth misplaced.
"Truth is by nature self-evident, as soon as you remove the cobwebs of ignorance that surround it, it shines clear."
Learn as if you were going to live forever. Live as if you were going to die tomorrow.
The strength to kill is not essential for self-defence; one ought to have the strength to die.
"My faith burns bright, as I hope it will even if I stood alone."
"Let us all be brave enough to die the death of a martyr, but let no one lust for martyrdom."
The principle of majority does not work when differences on fundamentals are involved.
"If we could erase the I's and mine's from religion, politics, economics, etc., we should soon be free and bring heaven upon earth."
In truth there as as many religions as there are individuals.
It has always been a mystery to me how men can feel themselves honored by the humiliation of their fellow beings.
Anger is the enemy of non-violence and pride is a monster that swallows it up.
"If one is able to stop smoking, he may continue, if he is unable to quit, then he must!"
"I have been known as a crank, faddist, madman. Evidently the reputation is well deserved. For wherever I go, I draw to myself cranks, faddists, and madmen."
Faith must be enforced by reason. When faith becomes blind it dies.
All crime is a kind of disease and should be treated as such.
Every living faith must have within itself the power of rejuvenation if it is to live
Breach of promise is a base surrender of truth.
"In a gentle way, you can shake the world."
"I claim no perfection for myself. But I do claim to be a passionate seeker after Truth, which is but another name for God."
My religion is based on truth and non-violence. Truth is my God. Non-violence is the means of realising Him.
Experience is the biggest of all schools.
God alone is the judge of true greatness because He knows men's hearts.
Freedom is never dear at any price. It is the breath of life. What would a man not pay for living?
Man falls from the pursuit of the ideal of plan living and high thinking the moment he wants to multiply his daily wants. Man's happiness really lies in contentment.
I have worshipped woman as the living embodiment of the spirit of service and sacrifice.
I will not let anyone walk through my mind with their dirty feet.
"Truth stands, even if there be no public support. It is self-sustained."
"All humanity is one undivided and indivisible family, and each one of us is responsible for the misdeeds of all the others. I cannot detach myself from the wickedest soul."
Anger and intolerance are the twin enemies of correct understanding.
To be effective it demands the sacrifice of the bravest and the most spotless.
"I know that I can do nothing. God can do every thing. O God, make me thy fit instrument and use me as thou wilt!"
"Hate the sin but love the sinner is a precept which though easy enough to understand is rarely practiced, and that is why the poison of hatred spreads in the world."
That action alone is just that does not harm either party to a dispute.

As food is necessary for the body. Prayer is necessary for the soul. Prayer is an impossibility without a living faith in the presence of God within. God demands nothing less than complete self-surrender as the price for the only real freedom that is worth having.
Fear is not a disease of the body; fear kills the soul.
What is true is that honesty is incompatible with the amassing of a large fortune.

There only is life where there is love. Life without love is death. Love is the reverse of the coin of which is the obverse is the truth. It is my firm faith that we can conquer the whole world by truth and love.
I would heartily welcome the union of East and West provided it is not based on brute force.
"However much I may sympathize with and admire worthy motives, I am an uncompromising opponent of violent methods even to serve the noblest of causes."
"What difference does it make to the dead, the orphans and the homeless, whether the mad destruction is brought under the name of totalitarianism or the holy name of liberty or democracy?"
"I claim that human mind or human society is not divided into watertight compartments called social, political and religious. All act and react upon one another."
Fear has its use but cowardice has none.
Defeat cannot dishearten me. It can only chasten me. I know that God will guide me. Truth is superior to man's wisdom.
"Suffering cheerfully endured, ceases to be suffering and is transmuted into an ineffable joy."
"All your scholarship, all your study of Shakespeare and Wordsworth would be vain if at the same time you do not build your character and attain mastery over your thoughts and actions."
Hate the sin but love the sinner.
"In matters of conscience, the law of the majority has no place."

"I shall pass through this world but once. Any good therefore that I can do or any kindness that I can show to any human being, let me do it now. Let me not defer or neglect it, for I shall not pass this way again."
"When I admire the wonder of a sunset or the beauty of the moon, my soul expands in worship of the Creator."
Culture of the mind must be subservient to the heart.

We are constantly being astonished at the amazing discoveries in the field of violence. But I maintain that far more undreamt of and seemingly impossible discoveries will be made in the field of nonviolence.
A living faith cannot be manufactured by the rule of majority
"Friendship that insists upon agreement on all matters is not worth the name. Friendship to be real must ever sustain the weight of honest differences, however sharp they be."
"If I had no sense of humor, I would long ago have committed suicide."
"It is the reformer who is anxious for the reform, and not society, from which he should expect nothing better than opposition, abhorrence and mortal persecution"
"The main purpose of life is to live rightly, think rightly, act rightly. The soul must languish when we give all our thought to the body."
An eye for an eye leaves everybody blind.
Morality which depends upon the helplessness of a man or woman has not much to recommend it. Morality is rooted in the purity of our hearts.
All the power I may have comes from God. But He does not work directly. He works through his numberless agencies.
What is a man if he is not a thief who openly charges as much as he can for the goods he sells?
"Unless your education is founded on truth, good character and purity of life, it is nothing worth. It will be like a house built on sand."
"I am prepared to die, but there is no cause for which I am prepared to kill."
I abhor vivisection with my whole soul. All the scientific discoveries stained with innocent blood I count as of no consequence.
He who is steadfast in meditation becomes firm and clear.
Commonsense is the realised sense of proportion.

"Truth resides in every human heart, and one has to search for it there, and to be guided by truth as one sees it. But no one has a right to coerce others to act according to his own view of the truth."

"Had we adopted non-violence as the weapon of the strong, because we realised that it was more effective than any other weapon, in fact the mightiest force in the world, we would have made use of its full potency and not have discarded it as soon as the fight against the British was over or we were in a position to wield conventional weapons."
"I know nothing of the science of astrology and I consider it to be a science, if it is a science, of doubtful value, to be severely left alone by those who have any faith in providence."
In prayer it is better to have a heart without words than words without a heart.
Life is an aspiration. Its mission is to strive after perfection. This is self-realization. The ideal must not be lowered because of our weaknesses or imperfections.
"First they ignore you, then they laugh at you, then they fight you, then you win."

"A leader is best when people barely know he exists, not so good when people obey and acclaim him, worse when they despise him. But of a good leader who talks little when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say, we did it ourselves."
"It is difficult, but not impossible, to conduct strictly honest business"
"Force, violence, pressure, or compulsion with a view to conformity, are both uncivilized and undemocratic."
"Uncleanliness of the mind is far more dangerous than that of the body. The latter, however, is an indication of the former."
The mice which helplessly find themselves between the cats teeth acquire no merit from their enforced sacrifice.
We do not need to proselytize either by our speech or by our writing. We can only do so really with our lives. Let our lives be open books for all to study.
"Truth is one, paths are many."
The pursuit of truth does not permit violence on one's opponent.
"Measures must always in a progressive society be held superior to men, who are after all imperfect instruments, working for their fulfilment."
Justice will come when it is deserved by our being and feeling strong.
I have nothing new to teach the world. Truth and Non-violence are as old as the hills. All I have done is to try experiments in both on as vast a scale as I could.
We must always seek to ally ourselves with that part of the enemy that knows what is right

I believe that true democracy can only be an outcome of nonviolence. The structure of a world federation can be raised only on a foundation of nonviolence and violence will have to be totally given up in world affairs.
Non-violence is an active force of the highest order.
Imitation is the sincerest flattery.
"Nearly everything you do is of no importance, but it is important that you do it."
Why change the world when we can change ourselves?
No culture can live if it attempts to be exclusive.
Your capacity to keep your vow will depend on the purity of your life.
It is my own firm belief that the strength of the soul grows in proportion as you subdue the flesh.
Rights that do not flow from duty well performed are not worth having.
Non-violence is not a quality to be evolved or expressed to order. It is an inward growth depending for sustenance upon intense individual effort.
"We should meet abuse by forbearance. Human nature is so constituted that if we take absolutely no notice of anger or abuse, the person indulging in it will soon weary of it and stop."

"I claim to be an average man of less than average ability. I have not the shadow of a doubt that any man or woman can achieve what I have, if he or she would make the same effort and cultivate the same hope and faith."
To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.
"Whatever you do may seem insignificant to you, but it is most important that you do it."
"Unselfishness preserves life, whereas love of the ego kills it."
The rich must live more simply so that the poor may simply live.
One can measure the greatness and the moral progress of a nation by looking at how it treats its animals
Man becomes great exactly in the degree in which he works for the welfare of his fellow-men.
I do not want to foresee the future. I am concerned with taking care of the present. God has given me no control over the moment following.
I do feel that spiritual progress does demand at some stage that we should cease to kill our fellow creatures for the satisfaction of our bodily wants.
Selfishness is blind.
"My life is an indivisible whole, and all my activities run into one another and they have their rise in my insatiable love of mankind."
"If patience is worth anything, it must endure to the end of time."

"Seven social sins: politics without principles, wealth without work, pleasure without conscience, knowledge without character, commerce without morality, science without humanity, and worship without sacrifice."
Those with the greatest awareness have the greatest nightmares.
Violent means will give violent freedom.
You must be the change you wish to see in the world

"The Roots of Violence: Wealth without work, Pleasure without conscience, Knowledge without character, Commerce without morality, Science without humanity, Worship without sacrifice, Politics without principles"
Monotony is the law of nature. Look at the monotonous manner in which the sun rises. The monotony of necessary occupation is exhilarating and life giving.
"Every worthwhile accomplishment, big or little, has its stages of drudgery and triumph; a beginning, a struggle and a victory."
It is health that is real wealth and not pieces of gold and silver.
We cannot be speakers who do not listen. But neither can we be listeners who do not speak.
"It may be possible to gild pure gold, but who can make his mother more beautiful?"
"Before the throne of the Almighty, man will be judged not by his acts but by his intentions. For God alone reads our hearts."
"Must I do all the evil I can before I learn to shun it? Is it not enough to know the evil to shun it? If not, we should be sincere enough to admit that we love evil too well to give it up."
"You may never know what results come of your actions, but if you do nothing, there will be no results."
"But for my faith in God, I should have been a raving maniac."
Prayer is a confession of one's own unworthiness and weakness.
Only he can take great resolves who has indomitable faith in God and has fear of God.
"If you have no character to lose, people will have no faith in you"
"There are limits to self-indulgence, none to restraint."
The human voice can never reach the distance that is covered by the still small voice of conscience.
Peace is its own reward.
A man of faith does not bargain or stipulate with God
Faith is not a delicate flower which would wither away under the slightest stormy weather
"In the final analysis a man is guided in his conduct by his own inner prompting's, though the examples of others may sometimes seem to guide him."
A nation's greatness is measured by how it treats its weakest members.
"Find purpose, the means will follow."
"To deprive a man of his natural liberty and to deny to him the ordinary amenities of life is worse then starving the body; it is starvation of the soul, the dweller in the body."
Destruction is not the law of humans.
Ahimsa is an attribute of the brave. Cowardice and Ahimsa don't go together any more that water and fire.
"I do all the evil I can before I learn to shun it? Is it not enough to know the evil to shun it? If not, we should be sincere enough to admit that we love evil too well to give it up."
"If you don't find God in the next person you meet, it is a waste of time looking for him further."

I worship God as Truth only. I have not yet found him but I am seeking after him. I am prepared to sacrifice the things dearest to me in pursuit of this quest. Even if the sacrifice demanded my very life I hope I may be prepared to give it.
"In the attitude of silence the soul finds the path in a clearer light, and what is elusive and deceptive resolves itself into crystal clearness."
Birth and death are not two different states but they are different aspects of the same state. There is as little reason to deplore the one as there is to be pleased over the other.
Corruption ought not to be an inevitable product of democracy.
A vow is a purely religious act which cannot be taken in a fit of passion. It can be taken only with a mind purified and composed and with God as witness.
There are many causes I would die for. There is not a single cause I would kill for.
Respect for all life is the foundation.
"Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony."

"God never answers the prayer of the arrogant, nor the prayers of those who bargains with him. If you would ask him to help you, go to him in all your nakedness; approach him without reservations, also without fear or doubts as to how he can help a fallen being like you."
Purity of personal life is the one indispensable condition for building up a sound education.
Good government is no substitute for self-government.
I first learned the concepts of non-violence in my marriage.
"I am but a seeker after truth. To find truth completely is to realize oneself and one's destiny. I am painfully conscious of my imperfections, and therein lay all the strength I possess."
We must become the change we want to see in the world.
"Non-cooperation is a measure of discipline and sacrifice, and it demands respect for the opposite views."
"Is it not enough to know the evil to shun it? If not, we should be sincere enough to admit that we love evil too well to give it up."
If we wish to create a lasting peace we must begin with the children.
"If co-operation is a duty, I hold that non-cooperation also under certain conditions is equally a duty."
I reject any religious doctrine that does not appeal to reason and is in conflict with morality.
Speak only if it improves upon the silence.
Hatred can be overcome only by love.
"I object to violence because when it appears to do good, the good is only temporary; the evil it does is permanent."
Capital as such is not evil; it is its wrong use that is evil
Love is the strongest force the world possesses and yet it is the humblest imaginable.
Honesty is incompatible with amassing a large fortune.
Where there is love there is life.

I offer you peace. I offer you love. I offer you friendship. I see your beauty. I hear your need. I feel your feelings. My wisdom flows from the Highest Source. I salute that Source in you. Let us work together for unity and love.
Truth is what the voice within tells you. Truth and nonviolence are perhaps the active forces you have in the world. Truth alone will endure; all the rest will be swept away before the tide of time.
They cannot take away our self respect if we do not give it to them.
"Men and women approaching retirement age should be recycled for public service work, and their companies should foot the bill. We can no longer afford to scrap-pile people."
Service which is rendered without joy helps neither the servant nor the served. But all other pleasures and possessions pale into nothingness before service which is rendered in a spirit of joy.
Non-violence is the first article of my faith. It is also the last article of my creed.
A man who throws himself on God ceases to fear man
What we are doing to the forests of the world is but a mirror reflection of what we are doing to ourselves and to one another.
What is true of the individual will be tomorrow true of the whole nation if individuals will but refuse to lose heart and hope.
"A man is but the product of his thoughts what he thinks, he becomes."

Restraint never ruins one's health. What ruins it is not restraint but outward suppression. A really self-restrained person grows every day from strength to strength and from peace to more peace. The very first step in self-restraint is the restraint of thoughts.
"Justice that love gives is a surrender, justice that law gives is a punishment."
Each one prays to God according to his own light.
Indolence is a delightful but distressing state; we must be doing something to be happy.
It is unwise to be too sure of one's own wisdom. It is healthy to be reminded that the strongest might weaken and the wisest might err.
It may be long before the law of love will be recognised in international affairs. The machineries of government stand between and hide the hearts of one people from those of another.
"As human beings, our greatness lies not so much in being able to remake the world - that is the myth of the atomic age - as in being able to remake ourselves."
The power of unarmed nonviolence is any day far superior to that of armed force.
The only tyrant I accept in this world is the still voice within.
"An error does not become truth by reason of multiplied propagation, nor does truth become error because nobody sees it."
Truth alone will endure; all the rest will be swept away before the tide of time.
I believe in equality for everyone except reporters and photographers.
"It is better to be violent, if there is violence in our hearts, than to put on the cloak of nonviolence to cover impotence."
"All compromise is based on give and take, but there can be no give and take on fundamentals. Any compromise on mere fundamentals is a surrender. For it is all give and no take."
"Non-violence is not a garment to be put on and off at will. Its seat is in the heart, and it must be an inseparable part of our being."
The good man is the friend of all living things.
The future depends on what we do in the present.

"Man often becomes what he believes himself to be. If I keep on saying to myself that I cannot do a certain thing, it is possible that I may end by really becoming incapable of doing it. On the contrary, if I have the belief that I can do it, I shall surely acquire the capacity to do it even if I may not have it at the beginning."
Self-respect knows no considerations.

The things that will destroy us are: politics without principle; pleasure without conscience; wealth without work; knowledge without character; business without morality; science without humanity; and worship without sacrifice.
I have endeavored to show that there is no real service of humanity in the profession [of medicine] and that it is injurious to mankind.
"My faith runs so very much faster than my reason that I can challenge the whole world and say, 'God is, was and ever shall be'."
The law of sacrifice is uniform throughout the world. To be effective it demands the sacrifice of the bravest and the most spotless.
Peace will not come out of a clash of arms but out of justice lived and done by unarmed nations in the face of odds.
"Even if you are a minority of one, the truth is the truth."
"Just as a man would not cherish living in a body other than his own, so do nations not like to live under other nations, however noble and great the latter may be."

"We are less than atoms, I say, because the atom obeys the law of its being, whereas we in the insolence of our ignorance deny the law of nature. But I have no argument to address to those who have no faith."
"A vow is fixed and unalterable determination to do a thing, when such a determination is related to something noble which can only uplift the man who makes the resolve."
"I cannot teach you violence, as I do not myself believe in it. I can only teach you not to bow your heads before any one even at the cost of your life."
Do not worry about what others are doing - each of us should turn the searchlight inward and purify his heart as much as possible.

Prayer needs no speech. It is in itself independent of any sensuous effort. I have not the slightest doubt that prayer is an unfailing means of cleansing the heart of passions. But it must be combined with the utmost humility.

"If we are to reach real peace in this world and if we are to carry on a real war against war, we shall have to begin with children; and if they will grow up in their natural innocence, we won't have to struggle, we won't have to pass fruitless idle resolutions."
"I am endeavoring to see God through service to humanity. For I know that God is neither in heaven, nor down below, but in everyone."
"To believe in something, and not live it, is dishonest."
"If you don't ask, you don't get."
Justice does not help those who slumber but helps only those who are vigilant.
Those who know how to think need no teachers.
"Personally, I hold that a man, who deliberately and intelligently takes a pledge and then breaks it, forfeits his manhood."
"I may be despicable person, but when Truth speaks through me I am Invincible."
"Providence has its appointed hour for everything. We cannot command results, we can only strive."
You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them.
God sometimes does try to the uttermost those whom he wishes to bless.
Infinite striving to be the best is man's duty; it is its own reward. Everything else is in God's hands.
There is no road towards peace; peace is the road

Your beliefs become your thoughts.  Your thoughts become your words.  Your words become your actions.  Your actions become your habits.  Your habits become your values.  Your values become your destiny.
We should never return blow for blow. Forgiveness is the ornament of the strong.
That service is the noblest which is rendered for its own sake.
"Earth provides enough to satisfy every man's need, but not every man's greed."
"If you have faith in the cause and the means and in God, the hot sun will be cool for you."
"You may think your actions are meaningless and that they won't help, but that is no excuse, you must still act."
Prayer is not asking. It is a longing of the soul.
I have also seen children successfully surmounting the effects of an evil inheritance. That is due to purity being an inherent attribute of the soul.
"Increase of material comforts, it may be generally laid down, does not in any way whatsoever conduce to moral growth."
A small body of determined spirits fired by an unquenchable faith in their mission can alter the course of history.
"If I have the belief that I can do it, I shall surely acquire the capacity to do it even if I may not have it at the beginning."
Non-violence is a weapon of the strong.
Action is no less necessary than thought to the instinctive tendencies of the human frame.

It is open to a war resister to judge between the combatants and wish success to the one who has justice on his side. By so judging he is more likely to bring peace between the two than by remaining a mere spectator.
"Satisfaction does not come with achievement, but with effort. Full effort is full victory."
"The moment the slave resolves that he will no longer be a slave, his fetters fall. Freedom and slavery are mental states."
"There is nothing that wastes the body like worry, and one who has any faith in God should be ashamed to worry about anything whatsoever"
Poverty is the worst form of violence.
The ideally non-violent state will be an ordered anarchy. That State is the best governed which is governed the least.
The law of love could be best understood and learned through little children.
"Truth quenches untruth, love quenches anger, self-suffering quenches violence. This eternal rule is a rule not for saints only but for all."
You assist an evil system most effectively by obeying its orders and decrees.
"Though we may know Him by a thousand names, He is one and the same to us all."

"The test of friendship is assistance in adversity, and that too, unconditional assistance. Co-operation which needs consideration is a commercial contract and not friendship. Conditional co-operation is like adulterated cement which does not bind."
Anger and intolerance are the enemies of correct understanding.
Non-violence in peace and war.
"Where love is, there God is also."
"Faith is not something to grasp, it is a state to grow into."

"I have no special revelation of God's will. My firm belief is that he reveals himself daily to every human being, but we shut our ears to the the still small voice. We shut our eyes to the pillar of fire in front of us. I realize his omnipresence."
Unwearied ceaseless effort is the price that must be paid for turning faith into a rich infallible experience.
Adaptability is not imitation. It means power of resistance and assimilation.
"Let everyone try and find that as a result of daily prayer he adds something new to his life, something with which nothing can be compared."
"I claim that in losing the spinning wheel we lost our left lung. We are, therefore, suffering from galloping consumption. The restoration of the wheel arrests the progress of the fell disease."
Jealousy does not wait for reasons.
It is beyond my power to induce in you a belief in God. There are certain things which are self proved and certain which are not proved at all.
To forgive is not to forget. The merit lies in loving in spite of the vivid knowledge that the one that must be loved is not a friend. What kind of victory is it when someone is left defeated?
Glory lies in the attempt to reach one's goal and not in reaching it.
Three-fourths of the miseries and misunderstandings in the world will disappear if we step into the shoes of our adversaries and understand their standpoint.

"The Seven Deadly Sins are wealth without work, pleasure without conscience, knowledge without character, business without morality, science without humanity, worship without sacrifice and politics without principle."
Honest differences are often a healthy sign of progress.
Each one has to find his peace from within. And peace to be real must be unaffected by outside circumstances.
"I claim to be a simple individual liable to err like any other fellow mortal. I own, however, that I have humility enough to confess my errors and to retrace my steps."
We may have our private opinions but why should they be a bar to the meeting of hearts?

I do not want my house to be walled in on all sides and my windows to be stuffed. I want the cultures of all the lands to be blown about my house as freely as possible. But I refuse to be blown off my feet by any.
There is a higher court than courts of justice and that is the court of conscience. It supercedes all other courts.
Life is an endless series of experiments.
The spirit of democracy cannot be imposed from without. It has to come from within.
Purity of mind and idleness are incompatible.
I can combine the greatest love with the greatest opposition to wrong.
We do not need to proselytise either by our speech or by our writing. We can only do so really with our lives. Let our lives be open books for all to study.
"Not to have control over the senses is like sailing in a rudderless ship, bound to break to pieces on coming in contact with the very first rock."
"Satisfaction lies in the effort, not in the attainment, full effort is full victory."
Are creeds such simple things like the clothes which a man can change at will and put on at will? Creeds are such for which people live for ages and ages.
Truth never damages a cause that is just.
One man cannot do right in one department of life whilst he is occupied in doing wrong in any other department. Life is one indivisible whole.
God comes to the hungry in the form of food.
Our life is a long and arduous quest after Truth and the soul requires inward restfulness to attain its full height.
"The only devils in this world are those running around in our own hearts, and that is where all our battles should be fought."

God simply is to those who have faith. He is all things to all men. He is in us and yet above and beyond us. He cannot cease to be because hideous immoralities or inhuman brutalities are committed in his name. He is long-suffering. He is patient but he is also terrible.
Nothing can be more hurtful to an honorable man than that he should be accused of bad faith.

"There is an orderliness in the universe, there is an unalterable law governing everything and every being that exists or lives. It is no blind law; for no blind law can govern the conduct of living beings."
The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated.
All business depends upon men fulfilling their responsibilities.
"A principle is the expression of perfection, and as imperfect beings like us cannot practise perfection, we devise every moment limits of its compromise in practice."
Prayer is the key of the morning and the bolt of the evening.
It is the quality of our work which will please God and not the quantity.
"Whenever you have truth it must be given with love, or the message and the messenger will be rejected."
"To my mind, the life of a lamb is no less precious than that of a human being. I should be unwilling to take the life of a lamb for the sake of the human body."
"A policy is a temporary creed liable to be changed, but while it holds good it has got to be pursued with apostolic zeal."
"I regard myself as a soldier, though a soldier of peace."
Spiritual relationship is far more precious than physical. Physical relationship divorced from spiritual is body without soul.
"Each night, when I go to sleep, I die. And the next morning, when I wake up, I am reborn."
There is a sufficiency in the world for man's need but not for man's greed.
"Faith becomes lame, when it ventures into matters pertaining to reason"

"Remember that all through history the way of truth and love has always won. There have been tyrants and murderers and for a time they seem invincible but in the end, they always fall -- think of it, ALWAYS."
What kind of victory is it when someone is left defeated?
Non-violence is the greatest force at the disposal of mankind. It is mightier than the mightiest weapon of destruction devised by the ingenuity of man.
"I do not believe in the doctrine of the greatest good of the greatest number. The only real, dignified, human doctrine is the greatest good of all."
"When restraint and courtesy are added to strength, the latter becomes irresistible."
My effort should never be to undermine another's faith but to make him a better follower of his own faith
"I will far rather see the race of man extinct than that we should become less than beasts by making the noblest of God's creation, woman, the object of our lust."
"Many could forgo heavy meals a full wardrobe a fine house et cetera, it is the ego they cannot forgo."
"When every hope is gone, when helpers fail and comforts flee I experience that help arrives somehow, from I know not where."
"Love never claims, it ever gives. Love ever suffers, never resents never revenges itself."

Keep your thoughts positive because your thoughts become your words. Keep your words positive because your words become your behavior. Keep your behavior positive because your behavior becomes your habits. Keep your habits positive because your habits become your values. Keep your values positive because your values become your destiny.
Everyone who wills can hear the inner voice. It is within everyone.
"Whenever you are confronted with an opponent, conquer him with love."
