Integrity without knowledge is weak and useless, and knowledge without integrity is dangerous and dreadful.
In looking for people to hire, look for three qualities: integrity, intelligence and energy. And if they don't have the first, the other two will kill you.
You can preach a better sermon with your life than with your lips.
Friendship with oneself is all-important, because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else.
A man cannot be comfortable without his own approval.
Of all the paths a man could strike into, there is, at any given moment, a best path... a thing which, here and now, it were of all things wisest for him to do... to find his path and walk in it.
What people call the spirit of the times is mostly their own spirit in which the times mirror themselves.
Never esteem anything as of advantage to you that will make you break your word or lose your self-respect.
People may fail many times, but they become failures only when they begin to blame someone else.
Any man's life will be filled with constant and unexpected encouragement if he makes up his mind to do his level best each day.
There are two kinds of people: those who do the work and those who take the credit. Try to be in the first group; there is less competition there.
Always imitate the behavior of the winner when you lose.
Nature never deceives us; it is always we who deceive ourselves.
He that falls in love with himself will have no rivals.
When speculation has done its worst, two and two still make four.
Good habits result from resisting temptation.
A wise man makes his own decisions; the ignorant goes with the crowd.
Before you make any decision, consider its effect on the next seven generations.
Once the 'what' is decided, the 'how' always follows. We must not make the 'how' an excuse for not facing and accepting the 'what.'
If you are an anvil, be patient; if you are a hammer, be strong.
Character, in the long run, is the decisive factor in the life of an individual and of nations alike.

If you will think about what you ought to do for other people, your character will take care of itself. Character is a by-product, and any man who devotes himself to its cultivation in his own case will become a selfish prig.
What someone is, begins to be revealed when his talent abates, when he stops showing us what he can do.
The function of education is to teach one to think intensively and to think critically... Intelligence plus character ? that is the goal of true education.
Character is that which reveals moral purpose, exposing the class of things a man chooses and avoids.
Fame is a vapor, popularity an accident, riches take wing, and only character endures.
Character is much easier kept than recovered.
No change of circumstances can repair a defect of character.
The force of character is cumulative.
Not in time, place or circumstance but in the man lies success.
It is with trifles, and when he is off guard, that a man best reveals his character.
Since the things we do determine the character of life, no blessed person can become unhappy, for he will never do those things which are hateful and petty.
Character is power.
To finish the moment, to find the journey's end in every step of the road, to live the greatest number of good hours, is wisdom.
We can really respect a man only if he doesn't always look out for himself.
All bullies are cowards, and most cowards are bullies.
A good reputation is something you must pay for, but you can never buy.

If there is beauty in character, there will be harmony in the home. If there is harmony in the home, there will be order in the nation. If there is order in the nation, there will be peace in the world.
One minute of patience can result in ten years of peace.
Decide on what you think is right, and stick to it.
Life is not a continuum of pleasant choices, but of inevitable problems that call for strength, determination, and hard work.
Life is like a game of cards. The hand that is dealt you represents determinism; the way you play it is free will.
Laws control the lesser person. Right conduct controls the greater one.
Failure is the mother of success.
You are responsible for you.
Wise people care not for that which they cannot have.
True strength lies in gentleness.
A clear conscience is a good pillow.
A guilty conscience needs no accuser.
If all the world hated you and believed you wicked, while your own conscience approved of you and absolved you from guilt, you would not be without friends.
Prudence reproaches; conscience accuses.
Reason often makes mistakes but conscience never does.
Conscience is thoroughly well-bred and soon leaves off talking to those who do not wish to hear it.
There is no witness so terrible, no accuser so powerful as conscience which dwells within us.
A regard for reputation and the judgment of the world may sometimes be felt where conscience is dormant.
The greatest of faults, I should say, is to be conscious of none.
He who steals an egg will steal a camel.
All a man can betray is his conscience.
Conscience is the voice of the soul.
...the safest course is to do nothing against one's conscience. With this secret, we can enjoy life and have no fear from death.
Never do anything against conscience even if the state demands it.
Labor to keep alive in your breast that little spark of celestial fire, called conscience.
To blame is easy; to do it better is difficult.
Examine what is said, not the person who speaks.
A person who cheats at play will cheat you any way.
An onion shared with a friend tastes like roast lamb.
A bad workman blames his tools.
We learn by watching and listening.
If you cannot catch a fish, do not blame the sea.
Charity doesn't excuse cheating.
Though force can protect in emergency, only justice, fairness, consideration and cooperation can finally lead men to the dawn of eternal peace.
Entering a village, obey the village.
Gratitude is the least of virtues, but ingratitude the worst of vices.
If my neighbor is happy, my own work will go easier, too.
In a community, it's better for every person to have a little of something than for one person to have everything.
Lock your door rather than suspect your neighbor.
Live so that when your children think of fairness, caring, and integrity, they think of you.
In the end we are always rewarded for our good will, our patience, fair-mindedness, and gentleness with what is strange.
In matters of style, swim with the current. In matters of principle, stand like a rock.
The time is always right to do what is right.
Two things fill my mind with ever-increasing wonder and awe: the starry heavens above me and the moral law within me.
We become just by the practice of just actions, self-controlled by exercising self-control, and courageous by performing acts of courage.
Fortune lost, nothing lost; courage lost, much lost; honor lost, more lost; soul lost, all lost.
Don't approach a goat from the front, a horse from the back, or a fool from any side.
When wealth is lost, nothing is lost. When health is lost, something is lost; when character is lost, all is lost.
A slave shows his true character, not while he is enslaved, but when he becomes a master.
Control of mental conduct, not skill, is the sign of a matured samurai.
He that's cheated twice by the same man is an accomplice with the cheater.
It’s easy to have principles when you're rich. The important thing is to have principles when you're poor.
Flattery makes friends, truth enemies.
He who steals once is always a thief.
Charity never made poor, stealing never made rich, and wealth never made wise.
Who lies for you will lie against you.
A thief is a thief, whether he steals a diamond or a cucumber.
A single penny fairly got is worth a thousand that are not.
When spider webs unite, they can tie up a lion.
If you damage the character of another person, you damage your own.
It is better to be loved than feared.
In order to exist, man must rebel.
Morality is the best of all devices for leading mankind by the nose.
The belly comes before the soul.
With our thoughts we make the world.
Freedom and constraint are two aspects of the same necessity, the necessity of being the man you are and not another. You are free to be that man, but not another.

Be happy. Talk happiness. Happiness calls out responsive gladness in others. There is enough sadness in the world without yours... never doubt the excellence and permanence of what is yet to be. Join the great company of those who make the barren places of life fruitful with kindness... Your success and happiness lie in you... The great enduring realities are love and service... Resolve to keep happy and your joy and you shall form an invincible host against difficulties.
Welcome everything that comes to you, but do not long for anything else.
All who would win joy, must share it; happiness was born a twin.
If all our happiness is bound up entirely in our personal circumstances, it is difficult not to demand of life more than it has to give.
Happiness is not the end of life: character is.
Life is a comedy for those who think and a tragedy for those who feel.
In spite of everything, I still believe that people are really good at heart.
There are two levers for moving men: interest and fear.
The tendency of mans nature to good is like the tendency of water to flow downward.
Necessity is an interpretation, not a fact.
Only the shallow know themselves.
When eating a fruit, think of the person who planted the tree.
The beauty of the soul shines out when a man bears with composure one heavy mischance after another, not because he does not feel them, but because he is a man of high and heroic temper.
The greatest cunning is to have none at all.
Do not use a hatchet to remove a fly from your friend's forehead.
With true friends...even water drunk together is sweet enough.
Do not want others to know what you have done? Better not have done it anyways.
Pray to God, but keep rowing toward(s) the shore.
Don't wrestle with pigs. You both get dirty and the pig likes it.
What you are afraid to do is a clear indicator of the next thing you need to do.
But if you ask what is the good of education in general, the answer is easy: that education makes good men, and that good men act nobly.
Imitation is a necessity of human nature.
The first step in the evolution of ethics is a sense of solidarity with other human beings.
Principles have no real force except when one is well fed.
No wind favors he who has no destined port.
All that is necessary for evil to triumph is for good men to do nothing.
The sad truth is that most evil is done by people who never make up their minds to be good or evil.
We either make ourselves happy or miserable. The amount of work is the same.

Nine requisites for contented living: Health enough to make work a pleasure. Wealth enough to support your needs. Strength to battle with difficulties and overcome them. Grace enough to confess your sins and forsake them. Patience enough to toil until some good is accomplished. Charity enough to see some good in your neighbor. Love enough to move you to be useful to others. Faith enough to make real the things of God. Hope enough to remove all anxious fears concerning the future.
A man can refrain from wanting what he has not and cheerfully make the best of a bird in the hand.
Happiness does not depend on outward things, but on the way we see them.
Great hopes make great men.
Those who believe they can do something are probably right and so are those who believe they can't.
No great deed is done by falterers who ask for certainty.
True goodness springs from a man's own heart. All men are born good.
It is silly to go on pretending that under the skin we are brothers. The truth is more likely that under the skin we are all cannibals, assassins, traitors, liars and hypocrites.
There is no grief which time does not lessen and soften.
New opinions are always suspected, and usually opposed, without any other reason but because they are not common.
Few men think, yet all will have opinions.
Do what you want to do... But want to do what you are doing. Be what you want to be... But want to be what you are.
Be honorable yourself if you wish to associate with honorable people.
Those people who are uncomfortable in themselves are disagreeable to others.
Lives of great people remind us we can make our lives sublime and, departing, leave behind footprints in the sand of time.
For greed, all nature is too little.
If thou thinkest twice before thou speakest once, thou wilt speak twice the better for it.
Making a thousand decisions, even the wise will make a mistake.
A good guitarist will play even if he has only one string.
He who asks a question may be a fool for five minutes; he who asks no questions stays a fool forever.
Be patient and calm for no one can catch fish in anger.
Anger is never without a reason, but seldom a good one.
Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great.
I shall allow no man to belittle my soul by making me hate him.

Instead of comparing our lot with that of those who are more fortunate than we are, we should compare it with the lot of the great majority of our fellow men. It then appears that we are among the privileged.
Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
Anger makes dull men witty, but it keeps them poor.
Bitterness is like cancer. It eats upon the host. But anger is like fire. It burns it all clean.
Never do anything when you are in a temper, for you will do everything wrong.
Deliberation is the function of the many; action is the function of one.
The superior man is modest in his speech, but exceeds in his actions.
The superior man acts before he speaks, and afterwards speaks according to his action.
Happiness lies not in the mere possession of money. It lies in the joy of achievement, in the thrill of creative effort.
Words without actions are the assassins of idealism.
I have always thought the actions of men the best interpreters of their thoughts.
I was seldom able to see an opportunity until it had ceased to be one.
Don't be too timid and squeamish about your actions. All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.
Nothing will ever be attempted if all possible objections must be first overcome.
A real decision is measured by the fact that you've taken a new action. If there's no action, you haven't truly decided.
When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don't adjust the goals, adjust the action steps.
Never confuse motion with action.
Action is the foundational key to all success.
Thought and theory must precede all salutary action; yet action is nobler in itself than either thought or theory.
Doubt, of whatever kind, can be ended by action alone.
Be wary of the man who urges an action in which he himself incurs no risk.
I count him braver who overcomes his desires than him who overcomes his enemies.
Let your desires be ruled by reason.
Man is the only animal whose desires increase as they are fed; the only animal that is never satisfied.
Manifest plainness, Embrace simplicity, Reduce selfishness, Have few desires.
There is no calamity greater than lavish desires. There is no greater guilt than discontentment. And there is no greater disaster than greed.
It is the nature of desire not to be satisfied, and most men live only for the gratification of it.
A man who views the world the same at fifty as he did at twenty has wasted thirty years of his life.
In order to succeed, your desire for success should be greater than your fear of failure.
The man who has confidence in himself gains the confidence of others.
All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence; then success is sure.
It's lack of faith that makes people afraid of meeting challenges, and I believed in myself.
It's the repetition of affirmations that leads to belief. And once that belief becomes a deep conviction, things begin to happen.
If I have lost confidence in myself, I have the universe against me.
Self-confidence is the first requisite to great undertakings.
If you have a talent, use it in every which way possible. Don't hoard it. Don't dole it out like a miser. Spend it lavishly like a millionaire intent on going broke.
Use what talents you possess: the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.
We are always more anxious to be distinguished for a talent which we do not possess, than to be praised for the fifteen which we do possess.
Whatever you are by nature, keep to it; never desert your line of talent. Be what nature intended you for and you will succeed.
Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence.
Nobody can make you feel inferior without your consent.
It's not who you are that holds you back, it's who you think you're not.
If you hear a voice within you say "you cannot paint," then by all means paint, and that voice will be silenced.
Put your future in good hands - your own.
If you really put a small value upon yourself, rest assured that the world will not raise your price.
They are the weakest, however strong, who have no faith in themselves or their own powers.
Thousands of geniuses live and die undiscovered - either by themselves or by others.
A great deal of talent is lost to the world for want of a little courage. Every day sends to their graves obscure men whose timidity prevented them from making a first effort.
Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.
The man who acquires the ability to take full possession of his own mind may take possession of anything else to which he is justly entitled.
Energy and persistence conquer all things.

Nothing in the world can take the place of Persistence. Talent will not; nothing is more common than unsuccessful men with talent. Genius will not; unrewarded genius is almost a proverb. Education will not; the world is full of educated derelicts. Persistence and determination alone are omnipotent. The slogan 'Press On' has solved and always will solve the problems of the human race.
That which we persist in doing becomes easier, not that the task itself has become easier, but that our ability to perform it has improved.
I hated every minute of training, but I said, "Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion."
Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all.
Most people never run far enough on their first wind to find out they’ve got a second.
All of us have bad luck and good luck. The man who persists through the bad luck - who keeps right on going - is the man who is there when the good luck comes - and is ready to receive it.
Remember that the man at the top of a mountain didn't just fall there.
When you feel like giving up, remember why you held on for so long in the first place.

People are always blaming circumstances for what they are. I don’t believe in circumstances. The people who get ahead in this world are the people who get up and look for the circumstances they want, and if they can’t find them, make them.
Winners never quit, and quitters never win.

Formulate and stamp indelibly on your mind a mental picture of yourself as succeeding. Hold this picture tenaciously. Never permit it to fade. Your mind will seek to develop the picture...Do not build up obstacles in your imagination.
I don't know the key to success, but the key to failure is trying to please everybody.
Try not to be a man of success but rather to be a man of value.
A great secret of success is to go through life as a man who never gets used up.
Success in business requires training and discipline and hard work. But if you're not frightened by these things, the opportunities are just as great today as they ever were.
It's not what happens to you that determines how far you will go in life; it is how you handle what happens to you.
The chief cause of failure and unhappiness is trading what we want most for what we want at the moment.
It doesn't matter who you are, where you come from. The ability to triumph begins with you, always.
Things work out best for those who make the best of how things work out.
Some people dream of great accomplishments, while others stay awake and do them.
Let no feeling of discouragement prey upon you, and in the end you are sure to succeed.
None of the secrets of success will work unless you do.
Nurture your mind with great thoughts; to believe in the heroic makes heroes.
When I am attacked by gloomy thoughts, nothing helps me so much as running to my books. They quickly absorb me and banish the clouds from my mind.
In every work of genius we recognize our own rejected thoughts; they come back to us with a certain alienated majesty.
The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts, therefore guard accordingly; and take care that you entertain no notions unsuitable to virtue, and reasonable nature.
The person who sends out positive thoughts activates the world around him positively and draws back to himself positive results.
Remember, happiness doesn't depend upon who you are or what you have; it depends solely upon what you think.
When you're doing the work you're meant to do, it feels right and every day is a bonus, regardless of what you're getting paid.

You've got to find what you love and that is as true for work as it is for lovers. Your work is going to fill a large part of your life and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. And the only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking and don't settle. As with all matters of the heart, you'll know when you've found it.
I'm a great believer in luck, and I find the harder I work the more I have of it.
Whoever does not love his work cannot hope that it will please others.
Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
Folks who never do more than they’re paid for, never get paid for any more than they do.
A professional is one who does his best work when he feels the least like working.
Derive happiness in oneself from a good day's work, from illuminating the fog that surrounds us.
Do not hire a man who does your work for money, but him who does it for love of it.
When you choose the paradigm of service, it turns everything you do from a job into a gift.
The more I want to get something done, the less I call it work.
Live neither in the past nor in the future, but let each day's work absorb your entire energies, and satisfy your widest ambition.
Work saves us from three great evils: boredom, vice and need.
Far and away the best prize that life offers is the chance to work hard at work worth doing.
Whenever it is in any way possible, every boy and girl should choose as his life work some occupation which he should like to do anyhow, even if he did not need the money.
Unless you are willing to drench yourself in your work beyond the capacity of the average man, you are just not cut out for positions at the top.
Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.
A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.
Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.
You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do.
He who is not courageous enough to take risks will accomplish nothing in life.
Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.
The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best.
If you want to succeed you should strike out on new paths, rather than travel the worn paths of accepted success.
If they can make penicillin out of moldy bread, they can sure make something out of you.
Know or listen to those who know.
Learn from the past, set vivid, detailed goals for the future, and live in the only moment of time over which you have any control: now.
People often say that motivation doesn’t last. Well, neither does bathing – that’s why we recommend it daily.
The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.
I cannot teach anybody anything. I can only make them think.
To find yourself, think for yourself.

Esteemed friend, citizen of Athens, the greatest city in the world, so outstanding in both intelligence and power, aren't you ashamed to care so much to make all the money you can, and to advance your reputation and prestige--while for truth and wisdom and the improvement of your soul you have no care or worry?

If you don't get what you want, you suffer; if you get what you don't want, you suffer; even when you get exactly what you want, you still suffer because you can't hold on to it forever. Your mind is your predicament. It wants to be free of change. Free of pain, free of the obligations of life and death. But change is law and no amount of pretending will alter that reality.
Education is the kindling of a flame, not the filling of a vessel.

Our youth now love luxury. They have bad manners, contempt for authority; they show disrespect for their elders and love chatter in place of exercise; they no longer rise when elders enter the room; they contradict their parents, chatter before company; gobble up their food and tyrannize their teachers.
Prefer knowledge to wealth, for the one is transitory, the other perpetual.
Let him who would move the world first move himself.
Thou shouldst eat to live; not live to eat.
Envy is the ulcer of the soul.
Beware of the barrenness of a busy life.
Be of good cheer about death, and know this of a truth, that no evil can happen to a good man, either in life or after death.
The secret of change is to focus all of your energy, not on fighting the old, but on building the new.
The really important thing is not to live, but to live well. And to live well meant, along with more enjoyable things in life, to live according to your principles.
Every heart sings a song, incomplete, until another heart whispers back. Those who wish to sing always find a song. At the touch of a lover, everyone becomes a poet.
There is truth in wine and children.
The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men.
Love is a serious mental disease.
There are three classes of men; lovers of wisdom, lovers of honor, and lovers of gain.
I'm trying to think, don't confuse me with facts.
Education is teaching our children to desire the right things.
Good actions give strength to ourselves and inspire good actions in others.
Death is not the worst that can happen to men.
Character is simply habit long continued.
Necessity is the mother of invention.
Love is the pursuit of the whole.
Music gives a soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imaginationand life to everything.
Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
Only the dead have seen the end of war.

Do not train a child to learn by force or harshness; but direct them to it by what amuses their minds, so that you may be better able to discover with accuracy the peculiar bent of the genius of each.
You can discover more about a person in an hour of play than in a year of conversation.
Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
What is a friend? A single soul dwelling in two bodies.
A friend to all is a friend to none.
Those who educate children well are more to be honored than they who produce them; for these only gave them life, those the art of living well.
Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.
Happiness depends upon ourselves.
Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all.
To avoid criticism say nothing, do nothing, be nothing.
Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.
Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.
To perceive is to suffer.

Anybody can become angry — that is easy, but to be angry with the right person and to the right degree and at the right time and for the right purpose, and in the right way — that is not within everybody's power and is not easy.
The educated differ from the uneducated as much as the living differ from the dead.

Excellence is never an accident. It is always the result of high intention, sincere effort, and intelligent execution; it represents the wise choice of many alternatives - choice, not chance, determines your destiny.
He who has overcome his fears will truly be free.
Man is the cruelest animal.
A good writer possesses not only his own spirit but also the spirit of his friends.
That which does not kill us makes us stronger.
It is hard enough to remember my opinions, without also remembering my reasons for them!
You have your way. I have my way. As for the right way, the correct way, and the only way, it does not exist.
The surest way to corrupt a youth is to instruct him to hold in higher esteem those who think alike than those who think differently.
What does your conscience say? — 'You should become the person you are'.
All I need is a sheet of paperand something to write with, and thenI can turn the world upside down.
There is always some madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness.
In heaven, all the interesting people are missing.
And those who were seen dancing were thought to be insane by those who could not hear the music.

The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe. If you try it, you will be lonely often, and sometimes frightened. But no price is too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself.
Sometimes people don't want to hear the truth because they don't want their illusions destroyed.
The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends.
I cannot believe in a God who wants to be praised all the time.
I would believe only in a God that knows how to dance.
The advantage of a bad memory is that one enjoys several times the same good things for the first time.
Faith: not wanting to know what the truth is.
What labels me, negates me.
He who would learn to fly one day must first learn to walk and run and climb and dance; one cannot fly into flying.
There are two different types of people in the world, those who want to know, and those who want to believe.
Perhaps I know best why it is man alone who laughs; he alone suffers so deeply that he had to invent laughter.

When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always.
Times are bad. Children no longer obey their parents, and everyone is writing a book.
Friendship improves happiness, and abates misery, by doubling our joys, and dividing our grief
If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need.
To be ignorant of what occurred before you were born is to remain always a child. For what is the worth of human life, unless it is woven into the life of our ancestors by the records of history?
To add a library to a house is to give that house a soul.
Laws are silent in times of war.
If we are not ashamed to think it, we should not be ashamed to say it.
The life given us, by nature is short; but the memory of a well-spent life is eternal.
If you can't explain it to a six year old, you don't understand it yourself.
If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales.
Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.
I speak to everyone in the same way, whether he is the garbage man or the president of the university.
Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school.
The best way to cheer yourself is to cheer somebody else up.
Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend.
You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
Live to the point of tears.
Blessed are the hearts that can bend; they shall never be broken.
There are causes worth dying for, but none worth killing for.
The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that your very existence is an act of rebellion.
To be happy, we must not be too concerned with others.
The purpose of a writer is to keep civilization from destroying itself.
Always go too far, because that's where you'll find the truth
I would rather live my life as if there is a God and die to find out there isn't, than live my life as if there isn't and die to find out there is.
Freedom is nothing but a chance to be better.
Always there comes an hour when one is weary of one's work and devotion to duty, and all one craves for is a loved face, the warmth and wonder of a loving heart.
If you make a mistake and do not correct it, this is called a mistake.
It is not the failure of others to appreciate your abilities that should trouble you, but rather your failure to appreciate theirs.
To be wronged is nothing, unless you continue to remember it.
Wherever you go, go with all your heart.

The change itself is nothing when we have made it, the next wish is to change again.

We believe we can change things according to our wishes because that’s the only happy solution we can see. We don’t think of what usually happens and what is also a happy solution: things do not change, by and by our wishes change.
There are many things in this world we would like to change, but we can not shape the world to our will.
Everything changes continually. What is history indeed but a record of change. And if there had been no changes in the past, there would have been little of history to write.
The wheel of change moves on, and those who were down go up and those who were up go down.
Progress is a nice word. But change is its motivator and change has its enemies.
Progress is impossible without change; and who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
We must always change, renew, rejuvenate ourselves; otherwise we harden.
Change is inevitable, but it is in us to control its content and direction.
Change yourself if you wish to change the world.
I am looking for a lot of men with infinite capacity for not knowing what cannot be done.
Don’t limit yourself. Many people limit themselves to what they think they can do. You can go as far as your mind lets you.
Chaos is a name for any order that produces confusion in our minds.
Order is Heaven’s first law.
A place for everything and everything in its place.
Cleanliness and order are not matters of instinct; they are matters of education, and like most great things, you must cultivate a taste for them.
To put the nation in order, we must put the family in order; to put the family in order. we must cultivate our personal life; and to cultivate our personal life, we must first set our hearts right.
Character building begins in our infancy and continues until death.
Not in the clamour of the crowded street, Not in the shouts and plaudits of the throng, But in ourselves, are triumph and defeat.
It is our duty to compose our character, not to compose books, and to win not battles and provinces, but order and tranquility for our conduct of life.
The crown and glory of life is character. It is noblest possession of man. It exercises a greater power than wealth and secures all the honour without the jealousies of fame.
Your character is what you really are while your reputation is merely what others think you are.
Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, ambition inspired, and success achieved.
Talent is nurtured in solitude; character is formed in the stormy billows of the world.
All your scholarship would be in vain it at the same time you do not build your character and attain mastery over your thoughts and actions.
The first duty of a university is to teach wisdom, not trade; character, not technicalities.
Education for its object that is formation of charactrer.
A man of character will make himself worthy of position he is given.
Character, not brain, will count at the crucial moment.
Intellect without character is likely to be dangerous, but what is character without intellect? How, indeed, does character develop?
Character must be kept bright as well as clean.
When wealth is lost, nothing is lost; When health is lost, something is lost; When character is lost, all lost!
In men whom men condemn as ill; I find so much of goodness still, In men whom men pronounce divine; I find so much of sin and blot; I do not dare to draw a line; Between the two, where God has not.
I am the owner of the sphere, Of the seven stars and the solar year, Of Caesar’s hand and Plato’s brain, Of Lord Christ’s heart and Shakespeare’s strain.

There are three Johns: 1. The real John; known only to his Maker; 2. John’s ideal John, never the real one, and often very unlike him; 3. Thomas’s ideal John, never the real John, nor John’s John, but often very unlike either.
Personality is to man what perfume is to a flower.
I recognize that I am made up of several persons and that the person that at the moment has the upper hand will inevitably give place to another. But which is the real one? All of them or none
The meeting of two personalities is like the contact of two chemical substances: if there is any reaction, both are transformed.
Personality is indefinable thing, a strange force that has power over the souls of men.
Every charitable act is a stepping stone toward heaven.
Charity begins at home, is the voice of the world.
With malice toward none; with charity for all.
Behold, I do not give lectures or a little charity, When I give, I give myself.
As the purse is emptied the heart is filled.
Charity is the perfection and ornament of religion.
The charitable man is loved by all; his friendship is prized highly.
The canal loves to think that rivers exist solely to supply it with water.
The hours that make us cheerful make us wise.
Cheerfulness keeps up a kind of daylight in the mind, filling it with a steady and perpetual serenity.
Let us be of good cheer, remembering that the misfortunes hardest to bear are those which never happen.
My religion of life is always to be cheerful.
Child is father of the man.
A child should always say what’s true And speak when he is spoken to, And behave mannerly at table; At least as far as he is able.
I do not love him because he is good, but because he is my little child.
The child is wise that weeps being born.
There’s only one pretty child in the world, and every mother has it.
Where once my careless childhood strayed. A stranger yet to pain.
The childhood shows the man, As morning shows the day.
Between the dark and the daylight, When the night is beginning to lower, Comes a pause in the day’s occupations, That is known as the Children’s Hour.
We think our children a part of ourselves, though as they grow they might very well underate us.
Children are hopes, Feel the dignity of a child. Do not feel superior to him, for your are not.
Children enjoy the present because they have neither a past nor a future.
Children have more need of models than of critics.
If your raise your children to feel that they can accomplish any goal or task they decide upon, you will have succeeded as a parent.
Children are our most valuable natural resource.
Few parents nowadays pay any regard to what their children say to them. The old fashioned respect for the young is fast dying out.
The greatest gift you and your partner can give your children is the example of an intimate, healthy, and loving relationship.

We are always too busy for our children; we never give them the time or interest they deserve. We lavish gifts upon them, but the most precious gift, our personal association, which means so much to them, we give grudgingly.
The difficulty in life is the choice.
Sometimes it is a good choice not to choose at all.
God offers to every mind its choice between truth and repose.
A coward turns away, but a brave man’s choice is danger.
Man is not the creature of circumstances. Circumstances are the creatures of man.
I am the very slave of circumstance And impulse – borne away with every breath!
To a philosopher no circumstance, however trifling is too minute
It is our relation to circumstances that determines their influence over us. The same wind that carries one vessel into port, may blow another off shore.
Civilization means a society based upon the opinion of civilians.
The three elements of modern civilization: Gun-powder, Printing and the Protestant Religion.
Civilisation is a progress from an indefinite, incoherent homogeneity toward a definite, coherent heterogeneity
We think our civilisation near its meridian, but we are yet only at the cock - crowing and the morning star.
Civilization is limitless multiplication of unnecessary necessaries.
A decent provision for the poor is the true test of civilization.

Civilisation, in the real sense of the term, consists not in the multiplication, but in the deliberate and voluntary reduction of wants. This alone promotes real happiness and contentment, and increases the capacity of service.
Civilisation is beauty of behaviour. It requires for its perfection patience, self - control and environment of leisure.
It is only an uncivilised world which would worship civilisation.
Clever men are good, but they are not best.
The silliest woman can manage a clever man; but it needs a very clever woman to manage a fool.
If you can’t be clever, be good.
Be good, sweet maid, and let who can be clever.
I believe life is constantly testing us for our level of commitment, and life’s greatest rewards are reserved for those who demonstrate a never - ending commitment to act until they achieve.
Common sense is very uncommon.
Common sense is genius homespun.
When I send a man to buy a horse, I do not want to be told how many hair the horse has in his tail. I wish only to know his points.
Good communication is as stimulating as black coffee and just as hard to sleep after.
To effectively communicate, we must realize that we are all different in the way we perceive the world and use this understanding as a guide to our communication with others.
Tears are the noble language of the eye.
A world community can exist only with world communication. It means common understanding, a common tradition, comman ideas and common ideals.
A communist is like a crocodile, When it opens its mouth you cannot tell whether it is trying to smile or preparing to eat you up.
Communism is the outcome of widespread misery due to social conditions, and unless these conditions are improved, mere repressions can be no remedy.
I have had playmates, I have had companions, In my days of childhood, in my joyful schooldays – All, all are gone, the old familiar faces.
Associate yourself with men of good quality if you esteem your own reputation; for it’s better to be alone than in bad company.
A pleasant companion reduces the length of the journey.
A man is better known by the company he keeps.
Terribly alone is he who misses companionship in the midst of the multitudinousness of life.
Being taken for granted can be a compliment. It means that you’ve become a comfortable, trusted person in another person’s life.
I can live for two months on a good compliment.
A compliment is something like a kiss through a veil.
Praise invariably implies a reference to a higher standard.
Praise does wonders for the sense of hearing.
Get someone else to blow your horn and the sound will carry twice as far.
And hearts that once beat high for praise, Now feel that pulse no more.
Many men know how to flatter, few know how to praise.
A refusal of priase is a desire to be praised twice.
Those who are greedy of praise prove that they are poor in merit.
They that value not praise will never do anything worthy of praise.
Praise the wise man behind the back, but a woman to her face.
Great tranquility of heart is his who cares neither for praise nor blame.
The more credit you give away, the more will come back to you. The more you help others, the more they will want to help you.
Think not those faithful who praise all thy words and actions, but those who kindly reprove thy faults.
Self - praise is no recommendation.
Conceit to human bodies what salt is to the ocean.
Conduct is three - fourths of our life and its largest concern.
It is the confession, not the priest, that gives us absolution.
Confess your sins to the Lord and you will be forgiven; confess them to man and you will be laughed at.
A clean confession combined with a promise never to commit the sin again, is the purest type of repentance.
Beauty is truth, truth is beauty, that is all ye know on earth, and all ye need to know.
‘Tis strange but true; for truth is always strange - stranger than fiction.
To be natural is such a very difficult pose to keep up.
What is true by lamplight is not always true in the sunshine.
Truth is a jewel which should not be painted over; but it may be set to advantage and shown in goodlight.
When a thing is funny, search it for a hidden truth.
Truth is the most valuable thing we have. Let us economise it.
We should not take offence when people hide the truth from us, since so often we hide it from ourselves.
I speak truth, not so much as I would, but as much as I dare; and I dare a little more as I grow older.
Servant of God, Well done! well hast thou fought The better fight, who single hast maintain’d, Against revolted multitudes the cause Of truth.
Truth is the foundation of real spirituality and courage is its soul.
Truth as systematic harmony means the reality of a divine experience.
I must speak the truth even about falsehood.
My way of joking is to tell the truth. It’s the funniest joke in the world.
A harmful truth is better than a useful lie.
One cannot reach truth, by untruthfulness. Truthful conduct alone can reach truth.
When in doubt, tell the truth.
Speaking truth is like writing fair and only comes by practice.
It is always the best policy to speak the truth, unless of course you are an exceptionally good liar.
The confidence which we have in ourselves gives birth to much of that which we have in others.
They conquer who believe they can.

An individual who breaks a law that conscience tells him is unjust, and who willingly accepts the penalty of imprisonment in order to arouse the conscience of the community over its injustice, is in reality expressing the highest respect for the law.
There is no pillow so soft as a clear conscience.
Conscience is the inner voice that warns us that someone may be looking.
I simply want to please my own conscience, which is God.
There is another man within me that’s angry with me.
The only tyrant I accept in this world is the “still small voice” within me.
Conscience was born when man had shed his fur, his tail, his pointed ears.
Conscience is the voice of the soul as the passions are the voice of the body. No wonder they often contradict each other.
The conscience of man does not determine his existence, rather his social existence determines his consciousness.
Conscience and cowardice are really the same thing. Conscience is the trade - name of the firm.
Contentment is natural wealth, luxury is artificial poverty.
All those who are contented with this life pass like a shadow and dream, or wither like the flower of the field.
True contentment is the power of getting out of any situation all that there is in it.
Conversation is the laboratory and workshop of the student.
Silence is one great art of conversation.
Conceit causes more conversation.
That is the happiest conversation of which nothing is distinctly remembered, but a general effect of pleasing impression.
Conversation between Adam and Eve must have been difficult at times because they had nobody to talk about.
What though the field be lost? All is not lost; th’ unconquerable will, And study of revenge, immortal hate, And courage never to submit or yield.
Courage is the first of human qualities because it is the quality which guarantees the others.
Courage is not the absence of fear, it is the master of it.
The courage we desire and prize is not the courage to die decently but to live manfully.
Perfect courage means doing unwitnessed what one would be capable of doing before the whole world.
Courage is almost a contradiction in terms. It means a strong desire to live, taking the form of readiness to die.

Those in this world who have the courage to try and solve in their own lives new problems of life are the ones who raise society to greatness. Those who merely live according to rule do not advance society, they only carry it along.
Without courage you cannot practise any other virtue.
Fear is slavery, work is liberty, courage is victory.
A man of courage is also full of faith.
Fortune favours the brave.
The small courtesies sweeten life; the greater ennoble it.
Life is not so short but that there is always time enough for courtesy.
How beautiful is humble courtesy!
Be courteous, treat the other fellow as thought he is as important as he thinks he is.
He was a coward to the strong: He was a tyrant to the weak.
Cowards can never be moral. Fear has its use but cowardice has none.
The world embarrasses me, and I cannot dream That this watch exists and has no watchmaker.
All I have seen teaches me to trust the creator for all I have not seen.
Many commit the same crimes with a different result. One bears a cross for his crime; another a crown.
People have go so accustomed to having life seasoned with crime and poverty that they cannot contemplate a life without it.
Poverty is the mother of crime.
Great crimes are committed by great ignoramuses.
The critics are sentinels in the grand army of letters.
The good critic is he who narrates the adventures of his soul among masterpieces.
Said the pot to the kettle, ‘Get away, blackface.’
Criticism is a disinterested endeavour to learn and propogate the best that is known and thought in the world.
Criticism is prejudice made plausible.
Criticism, as it was first instituted by Aristotle, was meant as a standard of judging well.
Criticism is a study by which men grow important and formidable at very small expense.
Criticism of public men is a welcome sign of public awakening. It keeps workers on the alert.
Throughout my life I have gained more from my critic friends than from my admirers.
I love criticism just so long as it’s unqualified praise
The trouble with most of us is that we would rather be ruined by praise than saved by criticism.
Reviewers are usually people who would have been poets, historians, biographers, if they could: they have tried their talents at one or the other, and have failed; therefore they turn critics.
To escape criticism - do nothing, say nothing, be nothing.
Culture is “to know the best that has been said and thought in the world.”
Culture cannot be imposed from outside but must develop from the people themselves.
Knowledge that is divorced from justice should be called cunning rather than wisdom.
Curiosity is the wick in the candle of learning.
Curiosity is one of the permanent and certain characteristics of a vigorous intellect.
We keep moving forward, opening new doors, and doing new things, because we are curious and curiosity keeps leading us down new paths.
The secret of happiness is curiosity.
A free curiosity has more efficiency in learning than a frightful enforcement.
Custom is the great guide of human life.
And custom lie upon thee with a weight, Heavy as frost, and deep almost as life!
There is no tyrant like custom and no freedom where its edicts are not restricted.
And God fulfils himself in many ways, Lest one good custom should not corrupt the world.
Dance is the poetry of the foot.
On with the dance! let joy be unconfin’d; No sleep till morn, when Youth and Pleasure meet To chase the glowing Hours with flying feet.
Dancing is the loftiest, the most moving, the most beautiful of the arts, because it is no mere translation or abstraction from life; it is life itself.
Come and trip it as ye go, On the light fantastic toe.
A timid person is frightened before a danger, a coward during the time and a courageous person afterwards.
Of the dead speak nothing but good.
When I am dead, my dearest, Sing no sad songs for me.
One owes respect to the living, to the dead one owes only the birth.
O’ Death! the poor man’s dearest friend – The kindest and the best.
Pale Death, with impartial step, knocks at the poor man’s cottage and the palaces of kings.
But O the heavy change, now thou art gone, Now thou art gone and never must return!
Like the dew on the mountain, Like the foam on the river, Like the bubble on the fountain, Thou art gone, and for ever!
Death is here and death is there, Death is busy every where, All round, within, beneath, Above is death - and we are death.
First our pleasures die – and then Our hopes, and then our fears – and when These are dead, the debt is due, Dust claims dust – and we die too.
Nothing can happen more beautiful than death.
The goal of life is death.
Death is the crown of life.
Death is as necessary for a man’s growth as life itself.
Death is our friend in that sense – life after life it faces us with the meaning of the ultimate.
Men fear death as children fear to go in the dark; and as that natural fear in children is increased with tales, so is the other.
It is because we fear death so much for ourselves that we shed tears over the death of others.
Death is the golden key that opens the palace of eternity.
Men do not die, they kill themselves.
It’s not that I’m afraid to die, I just don’t want to be there when it happens.
Debt is the slavery of the free.
The second vice is by lying, the first is running into debt.
There can be no freedom or beauty about a homelife that depends on borrowing and debt.
Do not accustom yourself to consider debt only as an inconvenience, you will find it a calamity.
O, What a tangled web we weave, When first we practice to deceive!
Once to every man and nation comes the moment to decide, In the strife of Truth and Falsehood, for the good or evil side.
In any moment of decision the best thing you can do is the right thing, the next best thing is the wrong thing, and the worst thing you can do is nothing.
It does not take much strength to do things, but it requires great strength to decide what to do.
Energy is Eternal Delight.
...that government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not perish from the earth.
Democracy means not “I am as good as you are”, but “You are as good as I am.”
Democracy means government by the uneducated, while aristocracy means government by the badly educated.
Democracy is based upon the conviction that there are extra ordinary possibilities in ordinary people.
Two cheers for democracy: one, because it admits variety and two, because it permits criticism.
Democracy demands discipline, tolerance and mutual regard.
With all my admiration and love for democracy, I am not prepared to accept the statement that the largest member of people are always right.
Where there a people of gods, their Government would be democratic.
Our desires always increase with our possessions. The knowledge that something remains yet unenjoyed impairs our enjoyment of the good before us.
It is easier to suppress the first desire than to satisfy all that follow it.
In moderating, not in satisfying desires, lies peace.
The generation of Americans has rendezvous with destiny.
A consistent man believes in destiny, a capricious man in chance.

It’s not what’s happening to you now or what has happened in your past that determines who you become. Rather, it’s your decisions about what to focus on, what things mean to you, and what you’re going to do about them that will determine your ultimate destiny.
Determination is the wake - up call to the human will.
Many things difficult to design prove easy to performance.
Do what is easy as if it were difficult and what is difficult as if it were easy.
Life would be dull and colourless but for the obstacles that we have to overcome and the fights that we have to win.
Dignity consists not in possessing honours but in the consciousness that we deserve them.
Perhaps the only true dignity of man is his capacity to despise himself.
No race can prosper till it learns that there is as much dignity in tilling a field as in writing a poem.
Never bend your head. Always hold it high. Look the world right in the eye.
The reason for having diplomatic relations is not to confer a compliment, but to secure a convenience.
When a diplomat says ‘yes’ he means ‘perhaps’; when he says ‘perhaps’ he means ‘no’; when he says ‘no’ he is no diplomate.
Sincere diplomacy is no more possible than dry water or wooden iron.
One thorn drives out another.
A diplomat is a man who remembers a lady’s birthday but forgets her age.
Disregard of the law of discipline and restraint is suicide.
Discipline is learnt in the school of adversity.
Ther’s not to make reply; Ther’s not to reason why; Ther’s but to do and die.
Discontent is the result of distrust in yourself. It is weak will manifest.
When you have got an elephant by the hind leg, and he is trying to run away, it’s best to let him run.
Think what you like, say what you ought.
Wrong is wrong only when you are at liberty to choose.
Great grief is a divine and terrible radiance which transfigures the wreteched.
Where the virgins are soft as the roses they twine, And all, save the spirit of man, is divine.
Can any mortal mixture of earth’s mould Breath such divine enchanting ravishment?
A dog starved at his master’s gate; Predicts the ruin of the state.
A dog is the only thing on earth that loves you more than himself.
The great pleasure of a dog is that you may make a fool of yourself with him and not only will he not scold you, but he will make a fool of himself too.
All our business in life is with doing: enjoyment and suffering come by themselves.
How many years you have to keep on doing, until you know what to do and how to do it.
The more we do, the more we can do; more busy we are, the more leisure we have.
He who wants to do everything will never do anything.
Positively, the best thing a man can have to do is nothing and, next to that, perhaps, good works.
To do nothing is the wisdom of those who have seen fools perish.
Let me say to you that to do nothing at all is the most difficult thing in the world, the most difficult, and it most intellectual.
There lives more faith in honest doubt, Believe me, than in half the creeds.
Doubt whom you will, but never doubt yourself.
He that knows nothing, doubts nothing.
I arise from dreams of thee; In the first sweet sleep of night, When the winds are breathing low, and the stars are shining bright.
But I, being poor, have only my dreams; I have spread my dreams under your feet; Tread softly, for you tread on my dreams.
Dreams are the true interpreters of our inclinations, but there is art required to sort and understand them.
Dream is the wife who must talk, sleep is husband who silently suffers.
If dreams are facts, facts may well be dreams.
Some people see things as they are and say why. I dream things that never were and they say why not
Dreams are the children of idle brain.
Drink! For you know not whence you came, nor why; Drink! For you know not why you go nor where.
Water is the only drink for a wise man.
Drink because you are happy, but never because you are miserable.
Drunkenness is temporary suicide; the happiness that it brings is merely negative, a momentary cessation of unhappiness.
Stern Daughter of the voice of God! O Duty! if that name thou love, Who art a light to guide, a rod To check the erring and reprove.
A sense of duty is useful in work, but offensive in relations.
Doing a thing from mere sense of duty is like eating when you are not hungry.
Not once or twice in our rough island story; The path of duty was the way to glory.
Make it a point to do something every day that you don’t want to do. This is the golden rule for acquiring the habit of doing your duty without pain.
The never - ending cycle of duty and right goes on ceaselessly on.
Other men live to eat, while I eat to live.
The proof of the pudding is in the eating.
More people are killed by over - eating and drinking than by the sword.
In general, mankind, since the improvement of cookery, eat twice as much as nature requires.
Economy is the art of making the most of life. The love of economy is the root of all virture.
He who will not economise will have to agonise.
Beware of little expenses, a small leak will sink a great ship.
Education is the chief defence of nations.
Education is the knowledge of how to use the whole of oneself.
Education is a continuing process from the minute we are born until we die.
The secret of education lies in respecting the pupil.
The things taught in schools and colleges are not an education, but the means of education.
The main fact about education is that there is no such thing. Education is a word like ‘transmission’ or ‘inherit-ance’, it is not an object, but a method.
Education consists mainly in what we have unlearned.
The great task of education is not merely to collect facts but to know man and to make oneself known to man.
Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught.
Education can’t make us all leaders, but it can teach us which leader to follow.
When the student is ready, the master appears.
What is education? A parcel of books? Not at all, but intercourse with the world, with men and with affairs.
In doing we learn.
Learning makes a good man better and an ill man worse.
Wear your learning like your watch, in a private pocket; and do not pull it out and strike it, merely to show that have one.
Learning is an ornament in prosperity, a refuse in adversity and a provision in old age.
Learning is wealth to the poor, an honour to the rich, an aid to the young and a support and comfort to the aged.
Learning, the destroyer of arrogance, begets arrogance in fools, even as light that illumines the eye, makes owls blind.
I am eager to learn, but I am not prepared to be taught.
When you feel that you know nothing then you are ready to learn.
The love of money and the love of learning rarely meet.
Men learn while they teach.
Things which hurt, instruct.
All wish to be learned, but no one is willing to pay the price.
Never learn to do anything: if you don’t learn, you’ll always find someone else to do it for you.
The great art of learning is to undertake but little at a time.
Learning is not a child’s play, we can not learn without pain.
In order to acquire learning, we must first shake ourselves free of it.
We should not ask who is the most learned, but who is the best learned.
View life as a continuous learning experience.
The first principle of true teaching is that nothing can be taught.
You cannot teach a man anything; you can only help him to find it within himself.
Those having torches will pass them on to others.
The art of teaching is the art of assisting discovery.
Delightful task! to rear the tender thought, To teach the young idea how to shoot.
If you give me rice, I’ll eat today; If you teach me how to grow rice, I’ll eat every day.
The mediocre teacher tells. The good teacher explains. The superior teacher demonstrates. The great teacher inspires.
In teaching there should be not class distinctions.
To be good is noble, but to teach others how to be good is nobler – and less trouble.
He who can, does. He who cannot, teaches.
The man who can make hard things easy is the educator.
A good teacher must know how to arouse the interest of the pupil in the field of study for which he is responsible
The essence of a self - reliant and autonomous culture is an unshakeable egoism.
The reason why lovers are never weary of one another is this – they are always talking of themselves
While listening senates hang upon thy tougue, Devolving through the maze of Eloquence A roll of periods, sweeter than her song.
The eloquence consists in saying all that is proper and nothing more.
Brevity is the charm of eloquence.
Flatter me, and I may not believe you. Criticize me, and I may not like you. Ignore me, and I may not forgive you. Encourage me, and I will not forget you.
Surround yourself with only people who are going to lift you higher.
There is nothing in the world so much admired as a man who knows how to bear unhappiness with courage.
It is impossible for any one not to have some enemies.
I admire a straightforward enemy.
A man cannot be too careful in the choice of his enemies.
Enthusiasm is energy that boils over and runs down the side of pot.
Enthusiasm finds the opportunities and energy makes the most of them.
Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.
We act as though comfort and luxury were the chief requirements of life, when all that we need to make us really happy is something to be enthusiastic about.
Enthusiasm is the yeast that makes your hopes rise to the stars. With it, there is accomplishment. Without it there are only alibis.
If you can give your son only one gift, let it be enthusiasm.
If passion drives you, let reason hold the reins.
God hath made us all equal.
I celebrate myself, and sing myself, And what I assume you shall assume, For every atom belonging to me as good belongs to you.
Equality consists in the same treatment of similar persons.
Equality may perhaps be a right, but no power on earth can ever turn it into a fact.
Some will always be above others. Destroy the inequality today, and it will appear again tomorrow.
Everybody should have an equal chance – but they shouldn’t have a flying start.
It is better that some should be unhappy than that none should be happy, which would be the case in a general state of equalty.
To make no mistakes is not in the power of man; but from their errors and mistakes the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.
Error is the force that welds men together; truth is communicated to men only by deeds of truth.
Error is not a fault of our knowledge but a mistake of our judgment giving assent to that which is not true.
It is best to own the error. It is sure to add to our strength.
A life spent in making mistakes is not only more honourable but more useful than a life spent in doing nothing.
Sometimes we may learn more from a man’s errors than from his virtues.
Truth will sooner come out of error than from confusion.
To a new truth there is nothing more harmful than old error.
A day is a miniature eternity.
There is little peace or comfort in life if we are always anxious as to future events. He that worries himself with the dread of possible contingencies will never be at rest.
For every evil under the sun, There is a remedy, or there is none; If there be one, try and find it, If there be none, never mind it.
Evil is wrought by want of Thought; As well as want of Heart.
What is evil – Whatever springs from weakness.
A little is often necessary for obtaining a great good.
The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
Evil by itself has no legs to stand upon.
A person may cause evil to others not only by his action but by his inaction, and in either case he is justly accountable to them for the injury.
There are three modes of bearing the ills of life - by indifference, which is the most common; by philosophy, which is the more ostentatious, and by religion, which is the most effectual.
Evil often triumphs, but never conquers.
A good example is the best sermon.
None preaches better than the ant, and she says nothing.
Example is better than percept.
The best things carried to excess are wrong.
It is dangerous to be too good.
The road of excess leads to the palace of wisdom.
An excuse is worse and more terrible than a lie, for an excuse is a lie garded.
It is often merely for an excuse that we say things are impossible.
Experience is the best of schoolmasters, only the school fees are heavy.
One thorn of experience is worth a whole wilderness of warning.
Life is a series of experience, each one of which makes us bigger.
No man’s knowledge can go beyond experience.
Experience is costly wisdom that is bought by experience – learning teacheth more in one year than experience in twenty.
Is there anyone so wise as to learn by the experience of others
If a man deceives me once, shame to him; if he deceives me twice, shame to me.
Experience teaches fools, and he is great one that will not learn by it.
A burnt child dreads the fire.
Drink to me only with thine eyes, And I will pledge with mine; Or leave a kiss but in the cup, And I’ll not look for wine.
He who can no longer pause to wonder and stand rapt is awe, is as good as dead; his eyes are closed.
Her eyes are homes of silent prayer.
The eye sees only what the mind is prepared to comprehend.
The eyes believe themselves; the ears believe other people.
The worst of faces still is human.
I never forget a face, but in your case I’m willing to make an exception.
Strong son of God, immortal Love, Whom we, that have not seen thy face, By faith, and faith alone, embrace, Believing where we cannot prove.
Faith is the bird that sings when the dawn is still dark.
Faith does not depend upon experience; it is something that is there before experience.
Faith is the force of life.
If you have faith in the cause and means and in God, the hot sun will be cool for you.
Faith is to believe what we do not see; and the reward of this faith is to see what we believe.
I do not want merely to possess a faith; I want a faith that possesses me.
I awoke one morning and found myself famous.
Fame is the perfume of heroic deeds.
Fame always goes with the principles.
He lives in fame who dies in virtue’s cause.
Fame is the spur that the clear spirit doth raise.
Blessed is he whose fame does not outshine his truth.
Passion for fame: a passion which is the instinct of all great souls.
No true and permanent fame can be founded except in labours which promote the happiness of mankind.
Fame is a magnifying glass.
All fame is dangerous, good bringeth envy, bad shame.
Wife and children are a kind of discipline of humanity.
Where does the family start It starts with a young man falling in love with a girl – no superior alternative has yet been found.
The happiest moments of my life have been the few which I have passed at home in the bosom of my family.
To bring up a child in the way he should go, travel that way yourself once in a while.

Everybody today seems to be in such a terrible rush, anxious for greater development and greater riches and so on, so that children have very little time for their parents. Parents have very little time for each other, and in the home begins the disruption of peace of the world.
The family that prays together stays together.
All are architects of Fate, Working in these walls of Time; Some with massive deeds and great, Some with ornaments of rhyme.
Let us, then, be up and doing, With a heart of any fate.
We make our fortunes and we call them fate.
Destiny has two ways of crushing us by refusing our wishes and by fulfilling them.
I do not believe in a fate that falls on men however they act; but I do believe in a fate that falls on them unless they act.
Prepare for the worst, expect the best and take what comes. This is fatalism.
Don’t find fault with what you don’t understand.
He who exhibits no fault is a fool or a hypocrite whom we should distrust.
Roses have thorns, and silver fountains mud. Clouds and eclipses stain both moon and sun, and loathsome canker lives in sweetest bud.
One can seldom see the beam in one’s own eye.

The fault of others is easily perceived, but that of oneself is difficult to perceive. A man winnows his neighbour’s faults like chaff, but his own fault he hides, as a cheat hides the false, die from the gambler.
None of us can stand other people having the same faults as ourselves.
In war there is no room for mistakes.
If you’re not making mistakes, then you’re not doing anything. I’m positive that a doer makes mistakes.
Any man may make a mistake, but none but a fool will continue in it.
If you simply take up the attitude of defending a mistake, there will be no hope of improvement.
To get maximum attention, it’s hard to beat a good, big mistake.
The only complete mistake is the mistake from which we learn nothing.
Nowadays most people die of a sort of creeping common sense, and discover when it is too late that the only things one never regrets are one’s mistakes.
Mistakes are painful when they happen, but years later a collection of mistakes is what is called experience.
No nation – perhaps no individual – has progressed without mistakes.
We learn and profit through our mistakes and failures.
I can see the humorous side of things and enjoy the fun when it comes, but look when I will, there seems to me always more sadness than joy in life.
I wear my heart on my sleeve.

If I feel depressed I will sing. If I feel sad I will laugh. If I feel ill I will double my labour. If I feel fear I will plunge ahead. If I feel inferior I will wear new garments. If I feel uncertain I will raise my voice.
Intense feeling too often obscures the truth.
The degree of one’s emotion varies inversely with one’s knowledge of the facts – the less you know the hotter you get.
To wear your heart on your sleeve isn’t a very good plan; you should wear it inside, where it functions best.
Some Specific; Anger is one letter short of danger.
Anger makes a rich man hated and a poor scorned.
A man makes his inferiors his superiors by heat.
Anger is momentary madness, so control your passion or it will control you.
Anger begins in folly and ends in repentance.
You can’t shake hands with a clenched fist.
Whatever is begun in anger, ends in shame.
Anyone can become angry. That is easy. But to be angry with the right person, to the right degree, at the right time, for the right purpose and in the right way - that is not easy.
I was angry with my friend; I told my wrath, my wrath did end. I was angry with my foe; I told it not, my wrath did grow.
Anger raises invention, but it overheats the oven.

I never work better than when I am inspired by anger; when I am angry, I can write, pray, and preach well, for then my whole temperament is quickened, my understanding sharpened, and all mundane vexations and temptations depart.
Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else; you are the one getting burned.
When angry, count ten before you speak; if very angry, an hundred.
Never answer a letter while you are angry.
Do not anticipate trouble, or worry about what may never happen. Keep in the sunlight.
What we anticipate seldom occurs; what we least expected generally happens.

Bitterness imprisons life; love releases it. Bitterness paralyzes life; love empowers it. Bitterness sours life; love sweetens it. Bitterness sickens life; love heals it. Bitterness blinds life; love anoints its eyes.
Boredom is the feeling that everything is a waste of time, serenity, that nothing is.
The few who do are the envy of the many who only watch.
Envy is almost the only vice which is practicable at all times and in every place.
Fear always springs from ignorance.
The one permanent emotion of the inferior man is fear.
There is great beauty in going through life, without anxiety or fear. Half our fears are baseless and the other half discreditable.
Fear is the proof of a degenerate mind.
The first duty of man is that of subduing fear.
Let us fear God and we shall cease to fear man.
The free man is he who does not fear to go to the end of his thought.
Do the thing you fear and the death of fear is certain.
I have accepted fear as a part of life... specifically the fear of change. ..I have gone ahead despite the pounding in the heart that says: turn back.!
No passion so effectively robs the mind of all its powers of acting and reasoning as fear.
Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure. It is our light, not our darkness, that most brightens us.
We are more often frightened than hurt; and we suffer more from imagination than from reality.

We pay a heavy price for our fear of failure. It is a powerful obstacle to growth. There is no learning without some difficulty and fumbling. If you want to keep on learning you must keep on risking failure– all your life.
A man who is afraid will do anything. As fear is a close companion to falsehood, so truth follows fearlessness.
It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
Fear is always a feeling to be rejected, because, what you fear is just the thing that is likely to come to you.
“I can forgive, but I cannot forget”, is only another way of saying, “I cannot forgive.”
And throughout all Eternity; I forgive you, you forgive me.
Good to forgive; Best to forget! Living, we fret; Dying, we live.
God pardons like a mother; who kisses the offence into everlasting forgetfulness.
Beware of the man who does not return your blow: he neither forgives you nor allows you to forgive yourself.
Forgiveness is the noblest revenge.
No blessed leisure for love or hope But only time for grief.
I sometimes hold it half a sin; To put in words the grief I feel; For words, like Nature, half reveal And half conceal the soul within.
Every substantial grief has twenty shadow and most of the shadows of your own making.
While grief is fresh, every attempt to divert only irritates. You must wait till grief be digested, and then amusement will dissipate the remains of it.
The greatest griefs are those we cause ourselves.
It is foolish to tear one’s hair in grief, as though sorrow would be made less by baldness.
Grief is a species of idleness.
It is dangerous to abandon oneself to the luxury of grief; it deprives one of courage, and even of the wish for recovery.
Nothing that grieves us can be called little: by the eternal laws of proportion a child’s loss of a doll and a king’s loss of a crown are events of the same size.
We never understand how little we need in this world until we know the loss of it.
The cheerful loser is a winner.
From the body of one guilty deed a thousand ghostly fears and haunting thoughts proceed.
He who flees from trial confesses the guilt
Guilt once harbored in the conscious breast, intimidates the brave and degrades the great.
Secret guilt by silence is betrayed.
Life without industry is guilt, industry without art is brutality.
There is no greater guilt than discontentment.
What hangs people... is the unfortunate circumstance of guilt.
Guilt: the gift that keeps on giving.
You have no more right to consume happiness without producing it than to consume wealth without producing it.
The summit of happiness is reached when a person is ready to be what he is.
Creative imagination is the core of happiness.
Happiness is not in doing what you like, but in liking what you do.
Happiness and work are really wedded together, for there can be no true happiness without feeling that one is doing something worthwhile.
Happiness is like coke something you get as a by- product in the process of making something else.
