The secret of happiness is this: let your interest be as wide as possible, and let your reactions to the things and persons that interest you be as far as possible friendly rather than hostile.
Happiness depends on what you can give, not what you can get.
The best secret of happiness is renunciation.
Happiness is a Swedish sunset - it is there for all, but most of us look the other way and lose it.
I have learned to seek my happiness by limiting my desires, rather than in attempting to satisfy them.
Many persons have the wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness. It is not attained through self- gratification but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
Happy is he who has overcome all selfishness; happy is he who has attained peace, and happy is he who has found the truth.
True happiness lies in the extinction of all emotions.
Now the heart is so full that a drop overfills it, We are happy now because God wills it.
Happy the man, and happy he alone, He who can call today his own, He who secure, within can say, Tomorrow do thy worst for I have liv’d today.
Hating people is like burning down your own house to get rid of a rat.
Hated by fools, and fools to hate, Be that my motto and my fate.
Men hate more steadily than they love.
People hate, as they love unreasonably.
Hate is the subtlest form of violence.
A man’s hatred is always concentrated upon that which makes him conscious of his bad qualities.
The love of the wicked is more dangerous than their hatred.
An intellectual hatred is the worst.
National hatred is something peculiar, you always find it strongest and most violent in the lowest degree of culture.
Hatred paralyzes life; lover releases it. Hatred confuses life; love harmonizes it. Hatred darkens life; love illuminates it.
While there’s is life, there’s is hope.
Hope springs eternal in the human breast: Man Never is, but always to be blest.
Hope is the poor man’s bread.
Hope is good breakfast, but is bad supper.
Hope for the best, but prepare for the worst.
He that leveth in hope dances without music.
Where no hope is left, is left no fear.
Hope is generally a wrong guide, though it is very good company by the way.
Teeth fall out, hair grow grey. Yet man clings to hope that plays him false.
If we had no faith in the ultimate God we would loss all hope.
In all things it is better to hope than to despair.
You can’t live on hope nor you live without it.
My hopes are not always realized, But I always hope.
Practice hope, As hopefulness becomes a habit, you can achieve a permanent happy spirit.
The greater the feeling of inferiority that has been experienced, the more powerful is the urge to conquest and the more violent the emotional agitation.
Jealousy is the most radical, primeval and naked form of admiration- admiration is war paint, so to speak.
Jealousy is always born with love, but does not always die with it.
There is more self- love than love in jealousy.
The whole conviction of my life now rests upon the belief that loneliness is the central and inevitable fact of human existence.
You cannot be lonely if you like the person you’re alone with.
A proud man is seldom a grateful man, for he never thinks he gets as much as he deserves.
They are proud in humility, proud in that they are not proud.
Proud men hate one another.
Pride that dines on vanity sups on contempt.

I have been more and more convinced, the more I think of it, that, in general, pride is at the bottom of all great mistakes. All the other passions do occasional good, but whenever pride puts in its work, everything goes wrong.
Pride: the general root of all harms.
Revenge is a kind of wild justice; which the more man’s nature runs to, the more ought law to weed it out.
Revenge is the poor delight of little minds.
A man that studieth revenge keeps his own wounds green, which otherwise would heal and do well.
The most tolerable sort of revenge is for those wrongs which there is no law to remedy.
Revenge is profitable, gratitude is expensive.
Woman and elephant never forget an injury.
He who injured you was either stronger or weaker. If he was weaker, spare him; if he was stronger, spare yourself.
It is often better not to see an insult than to avenge it.
Vengeance is a dish that should be eaten cold.
Every heart has its secret sorrows, which the world knows not.
Better by far you should forget and smile Than that you should remember and be sad.
Dark tree, still sad when others grief is fled, The only constant mourner o’er the dead!
We look before and after; And pine for what is not. Our sincerest laughter; With same pain is fraught, Our sweetest songs are those; That tell of saddest thought.
The old know what they want; the young are sad and bewildered.
I never wonder to see man wicked, but I often wonder not to see them ashamed.
Shame may restrain what law does not prohibit.
While shame keeps the watch, value is not wholly extinguished in the heart.
When people are ashamed they hold aloof, above all from those nearest to them.
Off with your hat as the flag goes by! And let the heart have its say; You’re man enough for a tear in your eye That you will not wipe away.
That flattery’s the food of tools.
Men are like stone jugs – you may jug them where you like by the ears.
Imitation is the sincerest (form) of flattery.
The most skilful flattery is to let a person talk on, and be listner
O! that man’s ears should be deaf to counsel, but not to flattery.
Full many a flower is born to blush unseen And waste its sweetness on the desert air.
Where flowers degenerate man cannot live.
Flowers are the sweetest things that God ever made and forgot to put a soul into.
God made the flowers to beautify the art and cheer man’s careful mood.
One thing is certain and the rest is lies; The flower that once has blown forever dies.
Hain’t we got all the fools in town on our side? And hain’t that a big enough majority in any town?
Fools rush in where angels fear to tread.

At thirty man suspects himself a fool; Knows it at forty, and reforms his plan; At fifty chides his infamous delay, Pushes his prudent purpose to resolve; In all the magnanimity of thought Resolves; and re-resolves; then dies the same.
Wise men have more to learn of fools than fools of wise man.
If you wish to avoid seeing a fool you must first break your looking glass.
A fool, though he lives in the company of the wise, understands nothing of the true doctrine, as a spoon tastes not the flavor of the soup.
A fool can tell the truth, but it requires a man of sense to know how to tell a lie.
He who thinks himself wise, O heavens! is a great fool.
One fool can ask more questions in a minute than twelve wise men can answer in an hour.
Let a fool be made serviceable according to his folly.
It is fortune, not wisdom, that rules man’s life.
Men are seldom blessed with good fortune and good sense at the same time.
Fortune never seems so blind as to those upon whom she has bestowed no favours.
Fortune truly helps those who are of good judgment.
If you are too fortunate, you will not know yourself. If you are too unfortunate, nobody will know you.
Of all the ways to make your fortune, the quickest and the best is to make people see clearly how much your success is in their interest.
Fortune makes a fool of him whom she favours too much.
The wheel of fortune turns round incessantly and who can say to himself, I shall today be uppermost.
Fortune knocks but once, but misfortune has much more patience.
Man is born free, yet everywhere he is in chains.
My angle – his name is Freedom – Choose him to be your king; He shall cut pathways east and west, And fend you with his wng.
We gain freedom when we have paid the full price for our right to live.
None can love freedom heartily but good men; the rest love not freedom, but licence
The only freedom which deserves the name is that of pursuing our own good in our own way, so long as we do not attempt to deprive others of theirs or impede their efforts to obtain it.
Freedom demands respect for the freedom of others.
Freedom is the right to one’s dignity as a man.
Freedom comes from human beings rather than from laws and institutions.
Real freedom is of the mind and spirit; it can never come to us from outside.
Personal liberty is the paramount essential to human dignity and human happiness.
Prosperity makes friends and adversity tries them.
The only way to have a friend is to be one
What is thine is mine, and all mine is thine.
Without friends no one would choose to live, though he had all other goods.
Reprove your friends in secret, praise them openly.
Doing all we can to promote our friend’s happiness is better than to continually drink to his prosperity.
God, send me a friend, that will tell me of my faults.
An acquaintance that begins with a compliment is sure to develop into a real friendship.
Friendship is the only cement that will hold the world together.
Friendship, peculiar boon of Heav’n, The noble mind’s delight and pride, To men and angels only giv’n, To all the lower world denied.
Friendship is single soul dwelling in two bodies.
True friendship is a plant of slow growth and must undergo and withstand the shocks of adversity before it is entitled to the appellation.
Friendship is almost always the union of a part of one mind with a part of another; people are friends in spots.
A broken friendship may be soldered, but will never be sound.
Friendship is the shadow of the evening, which strengthens with the setting sun of life.
It’s no good trying to keep up old friendships. It’s painful for both sides, The fact is, one grows out of people, and the only thing is to fact it.
There was the Door to which I found no key; There was the Veil through which I might not see.
I never think of the future. It comes soon enough.
Ignorance of future ills is a more useful thing than knowledge.
Trust no Future, howe’er pleasant! Let the dead past bury its dead!
The future is purchased by the present.
Take care of the present and the future will take care of itself.
Nothing can guarantee the future. The best we can do is to seize up the chances, calculate the risks involved, estimate our ability to deal with them, and then make our plans with confidence.
Heav’n from all creatures hides the Book of Fat. All but the page prescribed, their present state.
The highest wisdom is never to worry about the future but to resign ourselves entirely to his will.
The trouble with the future is that it usually arrives before we’re ready for it.
For I dipt into the future, far as human eye could see, Saw the vision of the world and all the wonder that would be.
When all else is lost, future still remains.
Who heeds not the future, will find sorrow at hand.
The best way to predict the future is to create it.
God Almighty first planted a garden. And, indeed, it is the purest of human pleasures.
The best place to seek God is in a garden. You can dig for him there.
We must cultivate our garden.
We are a generation not in revolt but in retreat.
Generosity, wrong placed, becometh a vice; a princely mind will undo a private family.
Doing easily what others find difficult is talent; doing what is impossible to talent is genius.
The eagle never lost so much time as when he submit-ted to learn of the crow.
Genius is one percent inspiration and ninty- nine percent perspiration.
When a true genius appears in the world, you may know him by this sign, that the dunces are all in confederacy against him.
Genius is master of man. Genius does what it must, and Talent does what it can.
Genius does not argue, it creates.
Genius consists of an infinite capacity for catching trains.
The secret of genius is to carry the spirit of the child into old age, which means never losing your enthusiasm.
Genius must be born, it can never be taught.
A man of genius has been seldom ruined, but by himself.
There is no great genius without a mixture of madness.
The principal mark of genius is not perfection but originality, the opening of new frontiers.
The greatest genius is never so great as when it is chastised and subdued by the highest reason.
The first and last thing required of genius is the love of truth.
I have nothing to declare except my genius.
He that hath pity upon the poor, lendeth unto the Lord.
That is no true alms which the hand can hold. He gives only the worthless gold; Who gives from a sense of duty.
From what we get, we can make a living; what we give, however, makes a life.
You give but little when you give of your possessions. It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.
Giving requires good sense.
We make a living by what we get. We make a life by what we give.
When a person is down in the world an ounce of help is better than a pound of preaching.
The nearest way to glory is to strive to be what you wish to be thought to be.
The road to glory is not strewn with flowers.
O how quickly passes away the glory of the earth.
For glory gives herself only to those who have always dreamed of her.
Before you score, you must have a goal.
Oh! yet we trust that somehow good will be the final goal of ill.
Life is real! Life is earnest! And the grave is not its goal.
The goal stands up, the keeper; Stands up to keep the goal.
On the journey to life’s highway, keep your eyes upon the goal.

First, have a definite, clear, practical ideal: a goal, an objective. Second, have the necessary means to achieve your ends: wisdom, money, materials and methods. Third, adjust all your means to that end.
Goals provide the energy source that powers our lives. One of the best ways we can get the most from the energy we have is to focus it. That is what goals can do for us; concentrate our energy.
Hitch your wagon to a star.
Do not turn back when you are just at the goal.
Goal is nothing but Godly order against laziness, so realise the goal.
No wind makes for him that hath no intended port to sail unto.
Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
When you come to roadblock, take a detour.
For what are obstacles to the lower creatures are opportunities to the higher life of man.
As long as one keeps searching, the answers come.
God is truth and light his shadow.
God shall be my hope, my stay, my guide and lantern to my feet.
An honest God is the noblest work of man.
God, the Great Giver, can open the whole universe to our gaze in the narrow space of a single lane.
If God did not exist, it would be necessary to invent him.
God is incorporeal, divine, supreme, infinite Mind, Spirit, Soul, Principle, Life, Truth, Love.
God is our expression for all forces and powers which we do not understand or with which we are unfamiliar.
Belief in God is an instinct as natural to man as walking on two legs.
For science, God is simply the stream of tendency by which all things seek to fulfil the law of their being.
If you want people believe in God, let people see what God can make you like.
God’s great power is in the gentle breeze, not in the storm.

God is that indefinable something which we all feel but which we do not know. To me God is truth and love, God is ethics and morality. God is fearlessness, God is the source of light and life and yet he is above and beyond all these. God is conscience. He is even the atheism of the atheist
It is God’s arrangement that they should be children of the past, possessors of the present, creators of the future. The past is our foundation, the present our material the future our aim and smmit.
The innermost being of God is perfect love which expands itself for others.
God respects me when I work, but he loves me when I sing.
God acts are the saviors of man.
There is no Good, there is no Bad; these be the whims of mortal will: That works me weal that I call ‘good’, what harms and hurts me I hold as ‘ill’.
The best is the enemy of the good.
Be good and you will be lonesome.

Roaming in thought over the Universe, I saw the little That is Good steadily hastening towards immortality, And the vast all that is called Evil I saw hastening to merge itself and become lost and dead.
There are two perfectly good men: one dead, and the unborn.
The whole of Government consists in the art of being honest.
No man is good enough to govern another man without that other’s consent.
Government is necessary, not because man is naturally bad...but because man is by nature more individualistic than social.
For in reason, all government without the consent of the governed, is the very definition of slavery.
The state is meant for man, not man for the state.
That Government is the best, which governs the best.
Governments exist to protect the rights of minorities. The loved and the rich need no protection– they have many friends and few enemies.
Government is a contrivance of human wisdom to provide for human wants.
All oppressive government is more to be feared than a tiger.
When any of the four pillars of government – religion, justice, counsel and treasure – are mainly shaken or weakened, men had need to pray for fair weather.
Gratitude is a fruit of great cultivation, you do not find it among gross people.
Gratitude is a duty which ought to be paid, but which none have a right to expect.
I believe the best definition of man is the ungrateful biped.
Do you think that every debt can be paid off with money?
That man is great, and he alone, Who serves a greatness not his own, For neither praise nor pelf; Content to know and be unknown: Whole in himself.
A really great man is known by three signs: generosity in the design, humanity in the execution, moderation in success.
All great men come out of the middle class.
No man ever yet became great by imitation.
Great and good are seldom the same men.
To be simple is to be great,
Greatness lies not in being strong, but in the right use of strength.
There is a great man who makes every man feel small. But the real great man is the man who makes every man feel great.
A truly great man never puts away the simplicity of a child.
No great man lives in vain. The history of the world is but the biography of great men.
Great men are the true men, the men in whom nature has succeeded.
Great minds must be ready not only to take opportunities, but to make them.
The world can not do without great men, but great men are troublesome to the world.
If any man seeks for greatness, let him forget greatness, and ask for truth, and he will find both.
How very weak the very wise, How very small the very great are!
Great men are not always wise.
Fish and visitors smell in three days.
The first day, a guest; the second day a burden; the third, a pest.
For I, who hold sage Homer’s rule the best, Welcome the coming, speed the parting guest.
The guts carry the feet, not the feet the guts.
The guts uphold the heart.
A habit is a shirt made of iron.
Habit is the enormous flywheel of society, its most precious conservative agent.
Habits are first cobwebs, then cables.
Habit, if not resisted, soon becomes necessity.
Great is the force of habit; it teaches us to bear labour and to scorn injury and pain.
An unfortunate thing about this world is that the good habits are much easier to give up than the bad ones.
It is easier to prevent bad habits than to break them.
Habit is habit and not to be flunge out of the window by any man, but coaxed downstairs a step at a time.
Health is not a condition of matter, but of Mind; nor can the material senses bear reliable testimony on the subject of health.
O health! health! the blessing of the rich! the riches of the poor! who can buy thee at too dear a rate, since there is no enjoying this world without thee
The preservation of health is duty. Few seem conscious that there is such a thing as physical morality.
He has health, has hope; and he who has hope, has everyting.
A sound mind is a sound body.
Health lies in laobur, and there is no royal road to it but through toil.
The fate of a nation has often depended on the good or bad digestion of a prime minister.
Good health and good sense are two of life’s greatest blessings.
God made our bodies temples of our souls, and they (atma) should be kept strong and clean, to be worthy of the deity that occupies them.
The higher your energy level, the more efficient your body. The more efficient your body, the better you feel and the more you will use your talent to produce outstanding results.
The only way to keep your health is to eat what you don’t want, drink what you don’t like, and do what you’d rather not.
It is healthy to be sick sometimes.
Early to bed and early to rise, Makes a man healthy, wealthy and wise.
When you can’t remember why you’re hurt, that’s when you’re healed.
A heart as soft, a heart as kind, A heart as sound and free; As in the whole world thou canst find, That heart I’ll give to thee.
The heart has no language, it speaks to the heart.
My heart is like a singing bird...; My heart is like an apple- tree...; My heart is like a rainbow shell...; My heart is gladder than all these, Because my love is come to me.
The heart of the fool is in his mouth, but the mouth of the wise man is in his heart.
As he thinketh in his heart, so he is.
The heart of the giver makes the gift dear and precious.
I think there is only one quality worse than hardness of heart, and that is softness of head.
Want and wealth equally harden the human heart, as frost and fire are both alien to the human flesh.
A good heart is better than all the heads in the world.
If wrong our hearts, our heads are right in vain.
Some people feel with their heads and think with their hearts.
The world is a comedy to those that think, a tragedy to those that feel.
Everyone speaks well of his heart, but no one dares to say it of his head.
The head is always the dupe of the heart.
Heaven means to be one with God.
Heaven lies about us in our infancy.
Heav’n but the Vision of fulfill’d Desire, And Hell the Shadow from a Soul on fire.
There is no Heaven, there is no Hell; these be the dreams of baby minds.
Here we may reign secure; and in my choice To reign is worth ambition, though in Hell: Better to reign in Hell, than serve in Heav’n.
The gates of hell are open night and day; Smooth the decent and easy is the way.
We are each our own devil, and we make this world our hell.
Hell is an outrage on humanity.
If you go to heaven without being naturally qualified for it, you will not enjoy yourself there.
The road to Hell is paved with good intentions.
A perpetual holiday is a good working definition of hell.
Every hero at last becomes a bore.
A hero is no braver than an ordinary man, but he is brave five minutes longer.
Hero- worship is strongest where there is least regard for human freedom.
Heroism is the brilliant triumph of the soul over fear.
Self- trust is the essence of heroism.
No man is a hero to his own wife: no woman is a wife to her own hero.
History is bunk.
What is history but a fable agreed upon
History of the world is but the biography of great men.
History can be well written only in a free country.
History is only interesting as long as it is strictly true.
History is indeed little more than the register of the crimes, follies and misfortunes of mankind.
Human history is in essence a history of ideas.
There is but a shallow stream of thought in history.
History is only a confused heap of facts.
Historian: An unsuccessful novelist.
Anybody can make history; only a great man can write it.
Sanctity is made up of little things, little virtues and actions.
Home is the place where, when you have to go there, They have to take you in.
Happy the man, whose wish and care; A few paternal acres bound, Content to breathe his native air; In his own ground.
Type of the wise, who soar, but never roam True to the kindred points of Heaven and Home.
He is happiest, be he king or peasant who finds peace in his home.
Home is where the heart is.
The word ‘home’ means more than the word ‘house’.
A crocodile at home, Can beat an elephant; But if he goes abroad, A dog can make him pant.
Home is the girl’s prison and the woman’s work house.
Houses are built to live in, not to look on, therefore, let use be preferred before uniformity.
Set not your house on fire to be revenged of the moon.
He that builds a fair house upon an ill seed committeth himself to prison.
He that lives in a glass house must not throw stone.
My theory on housework is, if the item doesn’t multiply, smell, catch fire or block the refrigerator door, let it be. No one else ears. Why should you?
Honesty is the first chapter of the book of wisdom.
An honest man is the noblest work of God.
Honesty with oneself is the condition of spiritual integrity.
And whether you’re an honest man or whether you’re a thief Depends on whose solicitor has given my brief.
It is discouraging to think how many people are shocked by honesty and how few by deceit.
For the governments honesty lies not only in saying what they are doing but also in doing what they say.
Lock your door and keep your neighbour honest.
Honour and shame from no condition rise; Act well your part; there all the honour lies.
When faith is lost, when honour dies, The man is dead.
A man of honour knows no false pride.
Honour is simply the morality of superior man.
Dignity does not consist in possessing honours, but in deserving them.
Show me the man you honour and I will know what kind of man you are.
The louder he talked of his honour, the faster we counted our spoons.
If somebody throws a brick at me, I can catch it and throw it back. But when somebody awards a decoration to me, I am out of words.
Honour is most capricious in her rewards. She feeds us with air, and often pulls down our house to build our monument.
He that desires honour is not worth of honour.
We honour the illustrious dead best by following their examples.
After all there is but one race– humanity.
I am a man, and nothing human can be of indifference to me.
Humanity is not the highest Godhead ; God is more than humanity but in humanity too we have to find and serve him.
Self interest is but the survival of the animal in us; humanity only begins for man with self- surrender.
The only real, dignified, human doctrine is the greatest good of all, and this can only be achieved by utmost self- sacrifice.
The true grandeur of humanity is in moral elevation, sustained enlightened and decorated by the intellect of man.
Only on paper has humanity yet achieved glory, beauty, truth, knowledge, virtue and abiding love.
It is easier to love humanity as a whole than to love one’s neighbour.
A humanitarian is always a hypocrite.
You must not lost faith in humanity. Humanity is an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty.
There is in human nature generally more of the fool than of the wise.
A person who is going to commit an inhuman act invariably excuses himself by saying, ‘I’ am only human, after all.
It’s casier to understand human nature by bearing in mind that almost everybody thinks he’s an exception to most rules.
The duty of man is the same in respect of his own nature as in respect of the nature of all other things, namely not to follow if but to amend it.
There is nothing that can be changed more completely than human nature when the job is taken in hand early enough.
I believe the first test of a truly great man is his humility.
The landscape painter must walk in the field with a humble mind.
We come nearest to the great when we are great in humility.
The hour of the greatest triumph is the hour of the greatest humility.
Many people want to be devout, but no one wants to be humble.
Pride changes angels into devils, humility makes man into angels.
To be humble to the superiors is duty, to equals courtesy, to inferiors nobleness.
The secret source of humour is not joy but sorrow; there is no humour in heaven.
A sense of humour is a sense of proportion.
Nothing spoils a romance so much as a sense of humour in the woman.
Good humour makes all things tolerable.
Good humour is one of the best articles of dress one can wear in society.
Honest humour is the oil and wine of a merry meeting.
A little commonsense, a little tolerance, a little good humour; and you don’t know how comfortable you can make yourself on this planet.
Good humaur is goodness and wisdom combined.
A husband is what is left of a lover, after the nerve has been extracted.
A woman must be a genius to create a good husband.
A good husband be deaf and good wife blind.
He knows little who will tell his wife all he knows.
One can always recognize women who trust their husbands. They look so thoroughly unhappy.
All other goods by Fortune’s hand are given, A wife is the peculiar gift of Heaven.
A man is in general better pleased when be has a good dinner upon table, than when his wife talks Greek.
The only comfort of my life. Is that I never yet had wife.
When a wife sins the husband is never innocent.
No man is hypocrite in his pleasures.
Hypocrisy is the homage, which vice pays to virtue.
The only vice which can not be forgiven is hypocrisy. The repentance of a hypocrite is itself hypocrisy.
A man is at his worst when he pretends to be good.
An idea is a point of departure and no more. As soon as you elaborate it, it becomes transformed by thought.
Ideas must work through the brains and the arms of good and brave men, or they are no better than dreams.
No army can withstand the strength of an idea whose time has come.
Bring ideas in and entertain them royally, for one of them may be the king.
To die for an idea: it is unquestionably noble, but how much nobler it would be if men died for ideas that were true.
An idea that is not dangerous is unworthy of being called an idea at all.
A man may die, nations may rise and fall, but an idea lives on. Ideas have endurance without death.
Everybody lives and acts partly according to his own, partly according to other people’s ideas.
Keep on the lookout for novel ideas that others have used successfully. Your idea has to be original only in its adaptation to the problem you’re working on.
Man’s mind, stretched by a new idea, never goes back to its original dimensions.
The ideas gained by men before they are twenty- five are practically the only ideas they shall have in their lives.
Timid thoughts, do not be afraid of me. I am the poet.
It is by acts and not by ideas that people live.
An idealist is one who, on noticing that a rose smells better than a cabbage, concludes that it will also make better soup.
When a man works for an ideal, he becomes irresistible.
Their only labour was to kill time.
Perhaps man is the only being that can properly be called idle.
Idleness is the holiday of fools.
Too much idleness, I have observed, fills up a man’s time much more completely, and leave him less his own master, than any sort of employment whatsoever.
Absence of occupation is not rest. A mind quite vacant is a mind distressed.
He is not only idle who does nothing, but he is idle who might be better employed.
To be ignorant of one’s ignorance is the malady of the ignorant.
I am not ashamed to confess that I am ignorant of what I do not know.
Ignorance is the night of the mind, a night without moon or star.
The truest characters of ignorance are vanity, pride and arrogance.
There is nothing more frightening than active ignorance.
There are many things of which a wise man might wish to be ignorant.
That man must be tremendously ignorant who answers every question that is put to him.
Ignorance is the condition necessary, I do not say for happiness, but for existence itself. If we knew all, we could not endure life for an hour.
Ignorance and error are necessary to life, like bread and butter.
Ignorance is the mother of research.
One of the best and fastest way of acquiring knowledge is to insist on remaining ignorant about things that aren’t worth knowing.
Ignorance is like a delicate exotic fruit; touch it and the bloom is gone.
The human race is governed by its imagination.
The great instrument of moral good is the imagination.
Imagination is eye of the soul.
He who has imagination without learning has wings but not feet.
Don’t give so much rein to your imagination – it does no good and only wastes your time.
And the man who plants cabbages imitates too!
A good imitation is the most perfect originality.
The nearer I approach the end, the plainer. I hear around me the immortal symphonies of the world which invite me. It is marvellous, yet simple.
Our hope of immortality does not come from any religion, but nearly all religions come from that hope.
What is human is immortal.
To desire immortality is to desire the eternal perpetuation of great mistake.
Immortality is when man dies but his word live on in man.
No one could ever meet death for his country without the hope of immortality.
‘Impossible’! That is not good French.
To the timid and hesitating everything is impossible because it seems so.
Few things are impossible to diligence and skill.
Nothing is impossible. There ways that lead to everything and we had sufficient will, we should have sufficient means, it is often merely for an excuse that we say things are impossible.
By asking for the impossible, We obtain the possible.
The first of earthly blessings, independence.
He travels the fastest who travels alone.
I would rather sit on a pumpkin and have it all to myself, than to be crowded on a velvet cushion.
I never thrust my nose into other men’s porridge. It is no bread and butter of mine: Every man for himself and God for us all.
It is better to rule in hell than to serve in heaven.
How happy is he born and taught, That serveth not another's will; Whose armour is his honest thought, And simple truth his utmost skill.
If you cannot mould yourself as you would wish, how can you expect other people to be entirely to your liking?
If you don’t design your own life plan, chances are that you’ll fall into someone else’s plan. And guess what they have planned for you Not much.
When individual interests become allied with public interests, then results are achieved.

Learn to limit yourself, to content yourself with some definite things, and some definite work; dare to be what you are, and learn to resign with a good grace all that you are not, and to believe in your own individuality.
One’s over haste to repay an obligation is a kind of ingratitude.
To do injustice is more disgraceful than to suffer it.
The seed ye sow, another reaps; The wealth ye find, another keeps; The robe ye weave, another wears; The arms ye forge, another bears.
A drop of ink may make a million think.
A writer is rarely so well inspired as when he talks about himself.
Inspiration and genius– one and the same.
The glow of inspiration warms us; it is a holy rapture.
No one was great without a touch of divine inspiration.
There is a deity within us who breathes that divine fire by which we are animated.
Be miserable, or motivate yourself. Whatever has to be done, it’s always your choice.

The whole idea of motivation is a trap. Forget motivation. Just do it. Exercise, loss weight, test your blood sugar, or whatever. Do it without motivation. And then, guess what? After you start doing the thing, that’s when the motivation comes and makes it easy for you to keep on doing it.
When someone says, ‘it’s not the money, It’s the principle’, it’s the money!
The intellect has only one failing, which to be sure, is a very considerable one. It has no conscience.
An intellectual is someone whose mind watches itself.
An intellectual is a man who takes more words than necessary to tell more than se knows.
The voice of the intellect is a soft one, but it does not rest till it has gained a hearing.
Our intellect is so made that it demands order and regularity in things. It resents accident and disorder.
It is only intellect that keeps me sane; perhaps this makes me over value intellect against feelings.
Intellect is invisible to the man who has none.
The human intellect delights in inventing specious arguments in order to support injustice itself.
The very first step towards success in any occupation is to become interested in it.
There are no uninteresting things, there are only uninterested people.
The virtue and vices are all put in motion by interest.
The devil loves nothing better than the intolerance of reformers and dreads nothing so much as their charity and patience.
Nothing dies so hard, so rallies so often, as intolerance.
It were better to be of no church, than to be bitter for any.
No human trait deserves less tolerance in everyday life, and gets less, than intolerance.
A tool is but the extension of a man’s hand, and a machine is but a complex toll. And he that invents a machine augments the power of a man and the well-being of mankind.
Civil reformation seldom is carried on without violence and confusion, whilst inventions are a blessing and a benefit without injuring or afflicting any.

It has been said that necessity as the mother of invention. If true, it seems strange that the world contains so many people in desperate circumstances. I rather suspect that relaxation is the mother of invention.
The right honourable gentleman is indebted to his memory for the jests and to his imagination for his facts.
Thou can’t joke an enemy into a friend, but thou may’st a friend into an enemy.
People resent a joke if there’s some truth in it.
There’s not a joy the world can give like that it takes away.
I have drunken deep of joy, And I will taste no other wine tonight.
Joy comes, grief goes, we know not how.
Rejoice, rejoice in the rejoicing of others and know that you include the world as joy in the depth of your sleep.
Everything else can be kept tied except joy.
When the guilty is acquitted, the judge is condemned.
Judges ought to be more learned than witty, more reverend than plausible, and more advised than confident. Above all things integrity is their portion and proper virtue.
And hungry judges soon the sentence sign, And wretches hang that jurymen may dine.
Be your own judge and you will be happy.
Judgment is forced on us by experience.
God will not look you over for medals, degrees or diplomas, but for scars.
‘Tis with our judgements as our watches, none Go just alike, yet each believes his own.
One cool judgement is worth a thousand hasty councils. The thing to do is to supply light and not heat.
One man’s word is no man’s word; we should quietly hear both sides.
There is so much good in the worst of us, And so much bad in the best of us. That it hardly becomes any of us; To talk about the rest of us.
Judge a tree from its fruit: not from the leaves.
If you judge people, you have no time to love them.
Be just before you are generous.
Justice is truth in action.
There is no virtue so truly great and godlike as justice.
The administration of justice is the firmest pillar of government.
The love of justice in most men is simply the fear of suffering injustice.
Justice without force is powerless, force without justice is tyrannical.
Justice discards party, friendship and kindred and is therefore represented as blind.
Exact justice is commonly more merciful in the long run than pity, for it tends to foster in man those stronger qualities which make them good citizens.
Justice without generosity may easily become Shylock’s justice.
The fundamentals of justice are that no one shall suffer wrong and that the public good be served.
The sentiment of justice is so natural and universally accepted by all mankind that it seems to be independent of all law, all party, all religion.
Justice is itself the great standing policy of civil society; and any departure from it, under any circumstance, lies under the suspicion of being no policy at all.
The price of justice is eternal publicity.
God’s mill grinds slow, but sure.
‘Twas a thief said the last kind word to Christ: Christ took the kindness, and forgave the theft.
Kindness is that brings forth kindness always.
Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear, and the blind can read.
A warm smile is the universal language of kindness.
To cultivate kindness is a valuable part of the business of life.
One can always be kind to people, one cares nothing about.
A kind heart is a fountain of gladness, making everything in its vicinity freshen into smiles.
Kindness is the golden chain by which society is bound together.
Kind hearts are more than coronets.
Kindness is very indigestible. It disagrees with very proud stomachs.
Every king springs from a race of slaves and every slave had kings among his ancestors.
Happy the kings whose thrones are founded on the people’s hearts.
The right divine of kings to govern wrong.
Kings will be tyrants from policy, when subjects are rebels from principle.
Better is a poor and wise child, than an old and foolish king.
God said, “I am tired of kings, I suffer them no more; Up to my ear the morning brings; The outrage of the poor.”
Rose kissed me today. Will she kiss me tomorrow? Let it be as it may, Rose kissed me today.
Soul meets soul on lovers’ lips.
Stolen kisses are always sweetest.
To a woman the first kiss is just the end of the beginning, but to a man it is the beginning of the end.
Lord! I wonder what fool it was that first invented kissing.
A long, long kiss, a kiss of youth, and love.
Leave a kiss but in the cup, And I’ll not look for wine.
Dear as remembered kisses after death, And sweet as those by hopeless fancy feign’d On lips that are for others.
Some women blush when they are kissed, some call for the police, some swear, some bite, but the worst are those who laugh.
Four sweet lips, two pure souls and one undying affection; these are love’s pretty ingredients for a kiss.

See the mountains kiss high Heaven, And the waves clasp one another; No sister- flower would be forgiven If it disdained its brother; And the sunlight clasps the earth, And the moonbeams kiss the sea: What is all this sweet work worth, If thou kiss not me
Our knowledge is the amassed thought and experience of innumerable minds.
With knowledge doubt increases.
Better know nothing than half know many things.
A little knowledge that acts is worth infinitely more than much knowledge that is idle.
I know nothing except the fact of my ignorance.
To know one’s ignorance is the best part of knowledge.
To know that we know what we know, and that we do not know what we do not know, that is true knowledge.
Knowledge is of two kinds. We know a subject ourselves, or we know where we can find information upon it.
To be conscious that you are ignorant is a great step to knowledge.
It is knowledge that ultimately gives salvation.
Strange how much you’ve got to know Before you know how little you know.
Learn from any who is wise, though a boy.
Knowledge is not something to be packed away in some corner of our brain.
If you have knowledge, let others light their candles with it.
The first and wisest of them all professed, To know this only, that he nothing knew.
Know thyself.
Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers.

Knowledge and wisdom, far from being on, Have oft times no connexion, knowledge dwells. In heads, replete with thoughts of other men; Wisdom in minds attentive to their own. Knowledge is proud he has learned so much, Wisdom is humble that he knows no more.
Be wiser than other people, if you can, but do not tell them so.
Those who wish to appear wise among fools, among the wise seem foolish.
A wise man sees as much as he ought, not as much as he can.
In youth and beauty wisdom is but rare!
Wisdom is not finally tested by the schools, Wisdom can not be pass’d from one having it to another not having it, Wisdom is of the soul, is not susceptible of proof; is its own proof.
It is the province of knowledge to speak and it is the privilege of wisdom to listen.
Men are wise in proportion, not to their experience, but to their capacity for experience.
Common sense in an uncommon degree is what the world calls wisdom.

Perfect wisdom has four parts Wisdom, the principle doing things a right. Justice, the principle of doing things equally in public and private. Fortitude, the principle of not fleeing danger, but meeting it. Temperance, the principle of subduing desires and living moderately.
The most manifest sign of wisdom is continued cheerfulness.
Neither your wisdom be with pride, nor your humility without wisdom.
All human wisdom is summed up in two words- wait and hope.
Labour conquers everything.
There is no real wealth but the labour of man.
Labour was the first price, the original purchase money that was paid for all things.
The labour of a human being is not a commodity or article of commerce.
I believe in the dignity of labour, whether with head or hand; that the world owes every man opportunity to make a living.
It is only by labour that thought can be made healthy, and only by thought that labour can be made happy, and the two cannot be separated with impunity.
With the idea that labour is the basis of progress goes the thought that labour must be free.
Toil is the lot of all, and better woe The fate of many.
He (God) is there where the tiller is tilling the hard ground and the path- maker is breaking stones. He is with them in sun and shower.
Every man is dishonest who lives upon the unpaid labour of others, no matter if he occupies a throne.
Honest labour bears a lovely face.
Language is a city to building of which every human being brought a stone.
Language, as well as the faculty of speech, was the immediate gift of God.
Custom is the most certain mistress of language, as the public stamp makes the current money.
I can not learn languages; men of ordinary capacity can learn Sanskrit in less time than it takes me to buy a German dictionary.
Accent is the soul of language, it gives to it both feeling and truth.
Languages are the pedigrees of nations.
The language of the law must not be foreign to the ears of those who are to obey it.
A languages is not an umbrella or an overcoat that can be borrowed by unconscious or deliberate mistake, it is like living skin itself.

Language is not an abstract construction of the learned, or of dictionary makers, but is something arising out of the work, needs, ties, joys, affections, tastes, of long generations of humanity, and has its bases broad and low, close to the ground.
The individual’s whole experience is built upon the plan of his language.
If I laugh at any mortal thing, ‘Tis that I may not weep.
Laugh and grow fat.
If you don’t learn to laugh at trouble, you won’t have anything to laugh at when you grow old.
But let me laugh a while, I’ve mickle time to grieve.
Laugh not too much, the witty man laughs last.
He laughs best who laughs last.
Laugh, and the world laughs with you, Weep, and you weep alone; For the sad old earth must borrow its mirth, But has trouble enough of its own.
A good laugh is sunshine in a house.
Laughing is the sensation of feeling good all over, and showing it principally in one spot.
He who has the courage to laugh is almost as much the master of the world as he who is ready to die.
Men show their character in nothing more clearly than in what they think laughable.
The burden of self is lightened when I laugh at myself.
We must laugh before we are happy for fear of dying without laughing at all.
You can turn painful situations around through laughter. If you can find humour in anything– even poverty– you can survive it.
Our sincerest laughter; With some pain is fraught.
Laughter is the sun that drives winter from the human face.
To provoke laughter without joining in it greatly heightens the effect.
Men have been wise in very different modes; but they have always laughed the same way.
Man alone suffers so excruciatingly in the world that he was compelled to invent laughter.
Law has certain lawful fictions upon which it groundeth the truth of justice.
Law and equity are two things which God hath joined, but which man hath put as under.
The execution of the laws is more important than the making of them.
Law too gentle are seldom obeyed; too severe, seldom executed.
The English laws punish vice; the Chinese laws do more, thy reward virtue.
Laws grind the poor, and rich men rule the law.
He that goes to law, holds a wolf by the ears.
In law nothing is certain but the expenses.
I never was ruined but twice- once when I gained a law- suit, and once when I lost one.
We do not get good laws to restrain bad people. We get good people to restrain bad laws.
The greater the number of statutes, the greater the number of thieves and brigades.
No law can be an “unchangeable law”. It must be based on knowledge, and as knowledge grows, it must grow with it.
When men are pure, laws are useless; When men are corrupt, laws are broken.
A true lawyer is one who places truth and service in the first place and the emoluments of the profession in the next place only.
The true function of the lawyer is to unite parties driven as under.
A lawyer’s opinion is worth nothing, unless paid for.
Necessity has no law; I know some attorneys of the same.
Whether you’re an honest man or whether you a thief Depends on whose solicitor has given me my brief.
Law- makers should not be law- breakers.
Lazy persons are always wanting to do something.
It looks as though the devil has deliberately put laziness on the frontiers of many a virtue.
I will build a car for the great multitude...so low in price that no man will be unable to own one.
There are two kinds of leaders– those interested in the flock and those interested in the fleece.
Lead, follow, or get out of way!

It is very comforting to believe that leaders who do terrible things are, in fact, mad. That way, all we have to do is make sure we don’t put psychotics in high places and we’ve got the problem solved.
Leaders must be close enough to relate to others, but far enough ahead to motivate them.
A good leader sets the example and can appeal to the emotions, spirit, conscious of his men as well as to their intellect. In this sense leadership is the projection of the leader’s personality.
Leadership is the art of getting some one else to do something that you want done because he wants to do it.
A good objective of leadership is to help those who are doing poorly to do well and to help those who are doing well to do even better.
Leisure with dignity.
The goal of war is peace and of business leisure.
Leisure is the mother of philosophy.
An intellectual improvements arise from leisure.
The thing that I should wish to obtain from money would be leisure with security.
Increased means and increased leisure are the two civilizers of man.
The difference between existence and life is the intelligent use of leisure.
The busiest men have the most leisure.
If you lend money, you make a secret foe; if you refuse it, an open one.
If you would lose a troublesome visitor, lend him money.
Lady, machine, gun, never give to anyone.
A liar needs a good memory.
A liar is a man who does not know how to deceive.
‘They say so’ is half a lie.
Even a liar tells 100 truths to one lie; he has to, to make the lie good for anything.
Telling lies is a fault in a boy, an art in a lover, an accomplishment in a bachelor, and second- nature in a married man.
Great talkers are great liars.
What light is to the eyes– what air is to the lungs– what love is to the heart, liberty is to the soul of man.
The God who gave us life, gave us liberty at the same time.
Eternal vigilance is the price of liberty.
We would rather die on our feat than live on our knees.
Give me the liberty to know, to think, to believe, and to utter freely according to conscience, above all other liberties.
Liberty is the only thing you cannot have unless you are willing to give it to others.
Liberty is a boisterous sea. Timid men prefer the calm of despotism.
Liberty has restraints, but no frontiers.
Liberty, too, must be limited, in order to be possessed.
Too little liberty brings stagnation, and too much brings chaos.
When liberty is gone, Life grows insipid and has lost its relish.
When the people contend for their liberty, they seldom get anything by their victory but new masters.
Liberty and democracy become unholy when their hands are dyed red with innocent blood.
The true University of these days is a collection of books.
A man’s library consists of the good books he has that no one wants to borrow.
A large library is apt to distract rather than to instruct the learner. It is much better to confine to a few authors than to wander at random over many.
Ask me no question, and I’ll tell you no fibs.
The cruellest lies are often told in silence.
Sin has many tools, but a lie is the handle which fits them all.
One of the most startling differences between a cat and a lie is that a cat has only nine lives.
Better a lie that soothes, than a truth that hurts.
A mixture of a lie doth ever add pleasure.
He who tells a lie is not sensible of how great a task he undertakes, for he must be forced to invent twenty more to maintain that one.
A lie which is half a truth is the blackest of lies.
Nature admits no lie.
A truth which is told with bad intent, beats all the lies you can invent.
Any fool can tell the truth, but it requires a man of some sense to know how to lie well.
Lying has a kind of respect and reverence with it. We pay a person the compliment of acknowledging his superiority whenever we lie to him.
The only form of lying that is absolutely beyond reproach is lying for its own sake.
He who cannot lie does not know what the truth is.
There is no greater lie than a truth misunderstood.
All the historical books which contain no lies are extremely tedius.
He who is not very strong in memory should not meddle with lying.
A person who does not tell lies, will not to believe that others tell them. From old habit, he can not break the connection between words and things.
We lie loudest when we lie to ourselves.
A liar is worse than a thief.
The web of our life is of a mingled yarn good and ill together.
Life is but a walking shadow, it is a tale Told by an idiot, full of sound and fury signifying nothing.
Life is a jest, and all things show it; I thought so once, but now I know it.
Tomorrow will I live, the fool does say: Today itself’s too late; the wise lived yesterday.
Each day is a little life, every waking and rising a little birth, every fresh morning a little youth, every going to rest and sleep a little death.
Life is a tragedy for those who feel, and a comedy for those who think.
Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.
Life is a flower of which love is the honey.
Life is a pure flame, and we live by an invisible sun within us.
One crowded hour of glorious life is worth an age without a name.
Life would be infinitely happier if we could only be born at the age of eighty and gradually approach eighteen.
Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a leaf.
One life– a little gleam of Time between two Eternities.
For life in general, there is but one decree: youth is a blunder, manhood a struggle, old age a regret.
Life like a dome of many- coloured glass Stains the white radiance of Eternity.
Life is like an onion, you peel it off one layer at a time, and sometimes you weep.
As long as you live, keep learning how to live.
Life is like a mirror, we get the best results when we smile at it.
Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.
Don’t thou love life Then do not squander time, for that is the stuff life is made of.
A useless life is an early death.
We are born crying, live complaining, and die disappointed.
To be what we are, and to become what we are capable of becoming, is the only end of life.
Life is a matter about which we are lost if we reason either too much or too little.
An aimless life is always a miserable life.
We are here to add what we can do, not to get what we can from life.
The value of life lies, not in the length of days, but in the use we make of them; a man may live long, yet live very little.
The good life is a happy life. I do not mean that if you are good you will be happy; I mean that if you are happy you will be good.
May you live all the days of your life.

Life is an opportunity, benefit from it. Life is beauty, admire it. Life is bliss, taste it. Life is a dream, realise it. Life is a challenge, meet it. Life is duty, complete it. Life is love, enjoy it. Life is mystery, know it. Life is a promise, fulfil it. Life is a sorrow, overcome it. Life is a song, sing it. Life is a struggle, accept it. Life is an adventure, dares it. Life is luck, make it. Life is too precious, do not destroy it. Life is life, fight for it.
Hail holy light, offspring of Heav’n firstborn!
Light is the shadow of God.
Know how to listen, and you will profit even from those who talk badly.
Listening is a magnetic and strange thing, a creative force.
To listen closely and reply well is the highest perfection we are able to attain in the art of conversation.
You cannot truly listen to anyone and do anything else at the same time.
I like to listen, I have learned a great deal from listening carefully. Most people never listen.
Great literature is simply language charged with meaning to the ultimate possible degree.
Literature always anticipates life. It does not copy it, but moulds it to its purpose.
Literature is the thought of thinking souls.
Literature is the art of writing something that will be read twice.
What is written without effort, is read without pleasure.
Classics are the noblest recorded thoughts of man.
The chief glory of every people arises from its authors.
The difference between literature and journalism is that journalism is unreadable, and literature is not read.
Those who apply themselves too closely to little things often become incapable of great things.
Little minds are wounded by the smallest things.
Life is a great bundle of little things.
Loquacity and lying are cousins.
Garrulity is a sign of stupidity.
We are all born for love...It is the principle of existence and its only end.
It’s love, it’s love that makes the world go round.
Perhaps they were right in putting love into books... Perhaps it could not live anywhere else.
There are many people who would never have been in love, if they had never heard love spoken of.
All thoughts, all passions, all delights, Whatever stirs the mortal frame, Are but the ministers of Love, And feed his sacred flame.
Love is the only glimpse we are permitted of eternity.
To say that you can love one person all your life is just like saying that one candle will continue burning as long as you live.
True lover never grows old.
The greatest happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved, loved for ourselves, or rather loved in spite of ourselves.
To fear love is to fear life, and those who fear life are already three pasts dead.
True love’s the gift of which God has given to man alone beneath the heaven.
Mutual love, the crown of all our bliss.
Love has the power to derive pleasure from mistakes, discords, incapacity. A mother’s love overflows at the false step of the child whom she is teaching to walk.
Love is love’s reward.
To love someone means to see him as God intended him.
God says to man, “I heal you, therefore I hurt, love you therefore punish.’’
A woman’s whole life is a history of the affections.
Alas! Our young affections run to waste, Or water but the desert.
Apprehension is where affection is. Where there is affection there is misery. Pain has its roots in love or affection. Renounce affection and you shall be happy.
Little is the luck I’ve had, And oh, ‘tis comfort small; To think that many another lad; Has had no luck at all.
Good luck befriend thee, Son; For at thy birth The fairy ladies danced upon the heath.
Shallow men believe in luck, wise and strong men in cause and effect.
Diligence is the mother of good luck.
What we call luck is the inner man externalized. We make things happen to us.
Opportunities are never lost. The other fellow takes those you miss.
Opportunities are like sunrises. If you wait too long you miss them.
An optimist sees an opportunity in every calamity; a pessimist sees calamity in every opportunity.
Catch the opportunity by the forelock, behind there is a bald head.
Opportunity has hair in front but is bald behind.
Beat the iron while it is hot; but we may polish it at leisure.
No great man ever complains of want of opportunity.
The opportunity for doing mischief is found a hundred times a day, and of doing good once in a year.
The greatest achievement of the human spirit is to live upto one’s opportunities and make the most of one’s resources.
To be a great man it is necessary to turn to account all opportunities.
If a window of opportunity appears, don’t pull down the shade.
One machine can do the wark of fifty ordinary men. No machine can do the work of one extra- ordinary man.
The mystery of mysteries is to view machines making machines.
Faith in machinery is our besetting danger.
Men are so necessarily mad, that not to be mad would amount to another form of madness.
There is a pleasure in madness, which none but madmen know.
Whom the gods destroy, they first make mad.
There are ways of curing madness, but none of righting the wrong- headed.
When we remember we are all mad, the mysteries disappear and life stands explained.
What a piece of work is a man! How noble in reason! How infinite in faculty! In form and moving how express and admirable! In action how like an angel! In apprehension how like a God!
There are many wonderful things in nature, but the most wonderful of all is man.
Man, biologically considered, is the most formidable of all the beasts of prey, and, indeed the only one that preys systematically on its own species.
Man is a rope connecting animal and superman – a rope over a precipice... What is great in man is that he is a bridge and not a goal.
Man is the highest animal. Indeed it is intelligence that separates man from the other animals.
Man is the only animal that laughs and weeps, for he is the only animal that is struck with the difference between what things are, and what they ought to be.
Man: a creature made at the end of the week’s work when God was tired.
Man is a reed, the weakest in nature, but he is a thinking reed.
Man is the measure of all things.
It is more important to study men than books.
Every man is a volume, if you know how to read him.
Most men are like eggs, too full of themselves to hold anything else.
I sometimes think that God in creating man somewhat overestimated his ability.
Man is undoubtedly an artist and creator.
Man is a piece of the universe made alive.
The nature of men is the same, it is their habits that separate them.
Every man is a consumer and ought to be a producer.
Man will become better only when you will make him see what he is like.
If a man is interested in himself only, he is very small; if he is interested in his family, he is larger; if he is interested in his community, he is larger still.
Not ‘How did he die’ but ‘how did he live’ Not ‘what did he get’ but ‘what did he give’ These are the units to measure the worth of a man as a man, regardless of birth.

He is a poor creature who does not believe himself to be better than the whole world else. No matter how ill we may be, nor how we may have fallen, we should not change identity with any other person.
And much it grieved my heart to think What Man has made of Man.
What times! What manners!
Good manners is the art of making those people easy with whom we converse. Whoever makes the fewest persons uneasy, is the best bred man in company.
Manners are of more importance than laws.
Good manners are made up of petty sacrifices.
Good manners brighten the personality.
Manners are the ornament of action and there is a way of speaking a kind word or doing a kind thing which greatly enhances its value.
Manners– a contrivance of wise men to keep fools at a distance.
The great secret is not having bad manners or good manners, but having the same manners for all the human souls.
Needles and pins, needles and pins, When a man marries his trouble begins.
Marriage is like life in this – that it is a field of battle, and not a bed of roses.
Marriage is a romance in which the hero dies in the first chapter.
It is better for a woman to marry a man who loves her than a man she loves.
A successful marriage requires falling in love many times, always with the same person.
Marriage is neither heaven nor hell. It is simply purgatory.
It is mind, not body, that makes marriage last.
Wives are young men’s mistresses, companions for middle age and old men’s nurses.
We sleep in separate rooms, we have dinner apart, we take separate vacations – we’re doing everything we can to keep our marriage together.
I think like any marriage, especially when you’ve had divorced parents like myself, you’d want to try even harder to make it work.
Deceive not thyself by overexpecting happiness in the married estate. Remember the nightingales which sing only some months in the spring, but commonly are silent when they have hatched their eggs.

Marriage is a framework to preserve friendship. It is valuable because it gives much more room to develop than just living together. It provides a base from which a person can work at understanding himself and another person.
A good marriage would be between a blind wife and a deaf husband.
Where there’s marriage without love, there will be love without marriage.
Matrimony - the high sea for which no compass has yet been invented.
Keep the eyes wide open before marriage; and half shut afterward.
To marry once is a duty; twice a folly, thrice is madness.
A man finds himself seven years older the day after his marriage.
Better be an old man’s darling than a young man’s slave.
The woman cries before the wedding, the man afterward.
Men marry because they are tired, women because they are curious: both are disappointed.
When the ego is dead is marriage true.
An apple a day keeps the doctor away.
God heals and doctor takes the fee.
He is the best physician that knows the worthlessness of most medicines.
Doctors are men who prescribe medicines of which they know little, to cure diseases of which they know less, in human beings of whom they know nothing.
There is no medicine against death.
It there be a hell upon earth it is to be found in a melancholy man’s heart.
Melancholy, indeed should be diverted by everything but drinking.

Long, long be my heart with such memories fill’d! Like the vase in which roses have once been distille’d: You may break, you may shatter the vase if you will, But the scent of the roses will hang round it still.
To live in hearts we leave behind, Is not to die.
There is no greater sorrow than to recall, in misery, the time when we were happy.
That which is bitter to endure may be sweet to remember.
Memory is the scribe of the soul.
Memory... is the diary that we all carry about with us.
Memory is what makes you wonder what you’ve forgotten.
Vanity plays lurid tricks with our memory.
A good memory is one trained to forget the trivial.
The secret of a good memory is attracting, and attention to a subject depends upon our interest in it. We rarely forget that which has made a deep impression on our minds.
The time art of memory is the art of attention.
Method is the mother of memory.
The man with a clear conscience probably has a poor memory.
Everyone complains of his lack of memory but nobody of his want of judgement.
Men and women belong to different species, and communication between them is a science still in its infancy.
Man has his will, but woman has her way.
If you want anything said, ask a man. If you want something done, ask a woman.
Women lie about their age, men about their income.
It is a woman’s business to get married as soon as possible, and a man’s to keep unmarried as long as he can.
Think what cowards men would be if they had to bear children. Women are an altogether superior species.
Women do not like timid men. Cats do not like prudent rates.
To control a man a woman must first control herself.
When men and women agree, it is only in their conclusions; their reasons are always different.
Man is the head, woman the neck. It is the neck that moves the head.
“Anxiety” describes a particular state of expecting the danger or preparing for it, even though it may be an unknown one. “Fear” requires a definite object of which to be afraid.
There is nothing so degrading, as the constant anxiety about one’s means of livelihood.
A crust eaten in peace is better than a banquet partaken in anxiety.
Do not push forward a wagon, you will only raise the dust about yourself. Do not think of all your anxieties, you will only make yourself ill.
At the rider’s back sits dark Anxiety.
Nothing in life is more remarkable than the unnecessary anxiety which we endure.
The world breaks everyone, and afterward many are strong at the broken places.
Depression is rage spread thin.
It’s a recession when your neighbour loses his job; it’s a depression when you lose yours.
If we admit our depression openly and freely, those around us get from it an experience of freedom rather than the depression itself.

Doubt is to certainty as neurosis is to psychosis. The neurotic is in doubt and has fears about persons and things; the psychotic has convictions and makes claims about them. In short, the neurotic has problems, the psychotic has solutions.
Neurosis is always a substitute for legitimate suffering.
Neurosis is no worse than a bad cold.
Sanity is madness put to good uses.
Insanity is often the logic of an accurate mind overtaxed.
Why is it when we talk to God, we’re said to be praying– but when God talks to us, we’re schizophrenic?
Among the attributes of God, although they are of God, although they are all equal, mercy shines with even more brilliancy than justice.
Teach me to feel another’s woe, To hide the fault I see; That mercy I to other show, That mercy show to me.
Merit can exist without dignity, but there is no dignity without some merit.
Charms strike the sight, but merit wins the soul.
If you wish your merit to be known, acknowledge that of other people.
I proclaim that might is right, justice the interest of the stronger. God - gifted organ-voice of England, Milton, a name to resound for ages.

The soul was like a Star, and dwelt apart; Thou hadst a voice whose sound was like the sea: Pure as the naked heavens, majestic, free, So didst thou travel on life’s common way; In cheerful godliness, and yet thy heart The lowliest duties on herself did lay.
The true, strong, and sound mind is the mind that can embrace equally great things and small.
God is mind, and God is infinite; hence all is mind.

Body and mind. We shall never get straight till we leave off trying to separate these two things. Mind is not a thing at all or, if it is, we know nothing about it. It is a function of body. Body is not a thing at all or, if it is, we know nothing about it. It is a function of mind.
A contended mind is the greatest blessing a man can enjoy in this world.
A person will be just about as happy as he makes up his mind to be.
Your prayer must be that you have a sound mind in a sound body.
Most of the time we think we’re sick. It’s all in the mind.
The mind must have some wordly objects to excite its attention; otherwise it will stagnate in indolence, sink into melancholy, or rise into visions and enthusiasm.

Mind is the most subtle of all elements in the phenomenal universe. All objectified consciousness has its origin in the mind. One who speaks or acts with a pure mind, happiness abides with him as his own shadow.
The perfect man uses his mind like a mirror. It grasps nothing; it refuses nothing. It receives but does not keep.
Empty mind is a devil’s workshop.
If you want peace of mind, do not find fault with others. Rather see your own faults.
Let us train our minds to desire what the situation demands.
Little things affect little minds.
Great minds have purpose, others have wishes. Little minds are tamed and subdued by misfortune, but great minds rise above them.
All the good qualities of different organs of the body are the ornaments of the mind.
The mind is its own place, and in itself can make a heaven of hell and a hell of heaven.
Truth, beauty and purification speak to us of a primal mind in whose experience they are eternally realised.
Miracles arise from our ignorance of nature, not from nature itself.
When we do the best that we can, we never know what miracle is wrought in our life or in the life of another.
Mysteries are not necessarily miracles.
Mireales seldom occur, except in the imaginations of the faithful.
I change, and so do women too; But I reflect, which women never do.
A mere Madness - to live like a wretch, that he may die rich.
If misery loves company, misery has company enough.
Misfortunes always come in by a door that has been left open for them.
We have all of us sufficient fortitude to bear the misfortunes of others.
Misfortunes test friends and detect enemies.
Misfortunes one can endure – they come form side, they are accidents. But to suffer for one’s own faults – oh! here is the sting of life.
It is well to treasure the memories of past misfortunes; they constitute our bank of fortitude.
It is best to rise from life as from a banquet neither thirsty nor drunken.
The moderation of fortunate people comes from the calm which good fortune gives to their tempers.
A responsible man needs only to practise moderation to find happiness.
He will always be a slave who does not know how to live upon a little.
In adversity assume the countenance of prosperity, and in prosperity moderate the temper and desires.
To live long it is necessary to live slowly.
Moderation is the secret of survival.
Modesty is to merit what shade is to figures in a picture; it gives strength and makes it stand out.
Women command a modest man, but like him not.
Modesty is the lowest of the virtues, and is a confession of the deficiency it indicates. He who undervalues himself is justly undervalued by others.
A false modesty is the refinement of vanity. It is a lie.
With people of only moderate ability, modesty is mere honesty; but with those who possess great talent, it is hypocrisy.
Modesty died when clothes were born.
If you want people to think well of you, do not speak well of yourself.
Though modesty be a virtue, yet bashfulness is a vice.
Money is like an arm or a leg - use it or lose it.
If you want to know what God thinks of money, look at the people He gives it to.
When I had money everyone called me brother.
He who multiplies riches, multiplies cares.
Money is like love; it kills slowly and painfully the one who withholds it, and enlivens the other who turns it on his fellow man.
When it is a question of money, everybody is of the same religion.
Money is a good servant but a bad master.
Money may not buy happiness, but with it you can be miserable in comfort.
To have enough is good luck, to have more than enough is harmful. This is true of all things, but especially of money.
Taking it all in all, I find it is more trouble to watch after money than to get.
Young people, nowadays, imagine that money is everything, and when they grow older they know it.
A man who both spends and saves money is the happiest man because he has both enjoyments.
A man without money is like a bow without an arrow.
Money will say more in one moment that the most eloquent love can in years.
They who are of opinion that money will do everything may very well be suspected to do everything for money.
Can anybody remember when the times were not hard and money not scarce?
Money is power. Money is security. Money is freedom. It is the difference between living on the slope of a volcano and being safe in the garden of hesperides.
Pennies do not come from heaven - they have to be earned here on earth.
Put not your trust in money, but put your money in trust.
A heavy purse makes a light heart.
The moving moon went up the sky, And no where did abide : Softly she was going up, And a star or two beside.
You meaner beauties of the night, That poorly satisfy our eyes; More by your number than your light You common people of the skies – What are you when the moon shall rise?
The moon has her light all over the sky, her dark spots to herself.
Morality is a private and costly luxury.
What we call ‘morals’ is simply blind obedience to words of command.
...What is moral is what you feel good after and what is immoral is what you feel bad after...
Morality is the custom of one’s country and the current feeling of one’s peers. Cannibalism is moral in a cannibal country.
Moral excellence comes about as a result of habit. We become just by doing just acts, temperate by doing temperate acts, brave by doing brave acts.
Verocity is the heart of morality.
Absolute morality is the regulation of conduct that pain shall not be inflicted.
Morality is not properly the doctrine of how we may make ourselves happy, but how we may make ourselves worthy of happiness..
Love would turn to poison unless it is strictly limited by moral consideration.
All sects are different because they come from men, morality is everywhere the same because it comes from God.
Do not be too moral, you may cheat yourself out of much life so. Aim above morality. Be not simply good; be good for something.
The only moral lesson which is suited for a child – the most important lesson for every time of life – is this : ‘Never hurt anybody.’
The grey – eyed morn smiles on the frowning night, Chequering the eastern clouds with streaks of light.
All that’s bright must fade - The brightest still the fleetest; All that’s sweet was made; But to be lost when sweetest.
All men think all men mortal but themselves.
Mother is the name for God in the lips and hearts of little children.
The future distiny of the child is always the work of the mother.
God could not be everywhere and therefore he made mothers.
If I were hanged on the highest hill, Mother o’mine, O mother o’ mine! I know whose love would follow me still, Mother o’mine, O mother o’ mine!
The angels... singing unto one another, Can find among their burning terms of love, None so devotional as that of “mother”.
Men are what there mothers made them.
A mother is a mother still, The holiest thing alive.
That best academy, a mother’s knee.
A mother is the truest friend we have, when trials, heavy and sudden, fall upon us...
Mother are fonder than fathers of their children because they are more certain they are their own.
When your mother asks, ‘Do you want a piece of advice?’ It’s a mere formality. It doesn’t matter if you answer yes or no. You’re going to get it anyway.
Nobody can misunderstand a boy like his own mother.
A mother exceedeth a thousand fathers in the right to reverence.
All that I am, or hope to be, I owe to my angel mother.
Spend at least one Mother’s Day with your respective (Mother - in - law) before you decide on marriage.
The two great movers of the human mind are the desire of good, and the fear of evil.
Man sees your action, but God your motives.
A man must be judged by his actions, not by the motives prompting them. God alone knows men’s hearts.
The morality of an action depends upon the motive from which we act.
When anyone takes great pleasure in doing a thing it is almost always from some motive other than the ostensible one.
Music, the greatest good that mortals know, And all of heaven we have below.
There’s music in the sighing of a reed; There’s music in the gushing of a rill; There’s music in all things, if man had ears: Their earth is but an echo of the spheres.
Music, when soft voices die, Vibrates in the memory.
Music is the language of the spirit, it opens the secret of life bringing peace, abolishing strife.
Music is the shorthand of emotion.
Virtue is the strong stem of man’s nature; and music is the blossoming of virtue.
In music man is revealed, and not in a noise. Our hearts will break if we do not sing.
Music is the only sensual pleasure without vice.
In sweet music is such art, killing care and grief of heart.
